boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 12
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Balkalor - male orc barbarian
Drindam - male orc artificer
Geovold - male gnome paige
Nibgibble - male gnome noble

boardgame.name: A Discordance with Dzyvatz
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Black Root of Abysmal Domination, sent to the material plane to beguile all humankind by Dzyvatz, a demon with a thirst for power and followers. His initial attempt was foiled, but the power of the root perseveres. Now a band of adventurers must destroy the root before it sews chaos across the land. This will be no easy task—the root must be returned to the domain of Dzyvatz, the depths of the Abyss!

A level 5 DCC compatible adventure.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Galaxy Black VI: Judges' Guide to the Collapsing Universe
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The penultimate secrets revealed. At last, the Judges guide to the Collapsing Universe!

294 pages of maximum space fantasy adventure World Makers, Alien Makers, Culture Makers, Adventure and campaign generators!

MORE SF fantasy – horror generators for a dark far future than you will ever know what to do with!

Plus Judges notes, details on the Empress Imperium, the Collapsing Universe, and how to use it all.

A quick finder for important elements in all six volumes.

An invaluable tool for Judges of any SF or fantastic space fantasy game.

In every way compatible with DCC!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Rubble and Ruin (Mythras)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The rising sun illuminates the vault door in the back of the partially collapsed office building. You have traveled through endless rubble of the dead city to find this long-sealed entrance. Is this the gateway to a forgotten military laboratory or just a storage vault of useless papers from the old world? The answer is yours to discover as you crawl into the rubble and ruin.

But whatever the answer is, this is not the same old dungeon!

Rubble and Ruin reimagines the classic dungeon crawl as a post-apocalyptic cyberpunk dystopia. Instead of wizards, sages, and clerics seeking lost magic, there are engineers, scientists, and physicians combing the ruins searching for Old Tech.

Players take roles like cyborg warriors, uplifted rat mechanics, transhuman scientists, robot engineers, or wild-type scavengers. Whatever the role, the characters are scavengers exploring the destroyed world, looking for the bits and bobs of old technology that can be repaired and traded to the surviving enclaves.

Powered by Mythras Imperative, Rubble and Ruin provides a complete near future post-apocalyptic world. Characters can be cyborgs or bioengineered mutants or any of ten different biotypes. Rubble and Ruin has extensive rules on Old Tech cover everything from electrical engineers building custom sensors and high-powered radios to chemists manufacturing explosives and medical supplies. Yet all characters know something about technology. Maybe your cyborg rolls their own ammunition with the Handloading specialty or your uplifted rat is an expert ay bypassing electric locks and cracking safes.

Be Advised. Post-apocalyptic games cover many different kinds of settings from ultra-realistic tails of life two hundred years after nuclear war to gonzo worlds of talking rabbits and telepathic plants to grim adventures set during a zombie apocalypse. This game is built around one setting. A re-interpretation of the canon fantasy as magicless science fiction setting, twenty years after the collapse of a dystopian cyberpunk civilization. The goal is to recreate the feel of an old school dungeon crawl in a science fiction, magic-free setting where technology and science replace spells and enchantment.

boardgame.name: Into the Rubble
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Both of the adventures in this book are designed to serve as introductions to the world of Rubble and Ruin. They are simple “rubble crawls” that require both tactical thinking and attention to detail. Together they can serve as a starting point to bring a party of prospectors together before heading off on an adventure of the GMs design.

Under the L is a short adventure designed to be played in one session. The setup is simple: the adventurers are prospectors working for the New Chicago Reclamation company. NCR prospectors have found many paths into the Rubble, and along one they noticed a hollow space where rubble and debris failed to collapse completely--it appears that the elevated train tracks, the L, created a tunnel heading into a particularly tall rubble pile. The PCs have been given salvage rights to anything they can clear out of the hole.

The Claim: Roosevelt and the River. This is a prospecting adventure for 4 to 6 starting characters. The player characters are a team of prospectors working with New Chicago Reclamation. They are given a claim to work--the area just north of the old Roosevelt Avenue east of the Chicago River. Here they will find both valuable Old Tech and creatures guarding it.

boardgame.name: Chicago Ruins
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chicago Ruins provides a Rubble and Ruin setting that GMs can jump into and use for their own games with a minimum of preparation. Alternatively, GMs can create their own ruins and salvage parts that they like from this setting, relocating them as desired.

The book contains maps and short descriptions of the various points of interest—with increasing focus on the ruins of Chicago. The descriptions are intended to act as seeds for players and the GM, rather than providing excessive detail. Players should work with the GM to develop their character’s backstories and to add relevant details to the various places and cultures.

The rear of the book reproduces many of the tables that are useful for players to access during a game.

boardgame.name: Free City of Carbondale
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world has been destroyed, and civilization has collapsed, but not everything is rubble and ruin.

The southern tip of the former state of Illinois, about 330 miles or 500 kilometers south of downtown Chicago is a corridor of former farmland that was spared from the worst of the collapse. New states, representing the different forces in the Global war, occupy portions of a one hundred- and fifty-mile-long strip of agricultural land. And the center of that strip of land is the city state of Carbondale.

The book outlines the major factions, industries, and shops that can be found in Carbondale twenty years after the Global Wars.

The Free City of Carbondale complements the Chicago Ruins and provides information to allow GMs to run Rubble and Ruin games that focus on more than just rubble crawls. Several adventure seeds and new social Enhancements are included.

boardgame.name: The Boer War
boardgame.description:
The Boer War is the first entry in this new series from Joseph Miranda and Canvas Temple Publishing. Boer War is based on the conflict between the British Empire and the Boer Republics of the Orange Free State and the Transvaal, which started in 1899 (generally known as the Second Boer War). The game covers the first year of the war; the conventional phase when the Boers could have gained a conventional victory. The latter part of the war was primarily a guerrilla conflict that did not officially end until 1902 and by which point a British victory was pretty much inevitable. In the game, each player is trying to seize an early victory: the British, in order to forestall the aforementioned guerrilla war, the Boers to gain sufficient support in Europe for their claims to full independence.

The game has three scenarios. Two of them begin with the commencement of hostilities in October 1899 and the initial Boer successes. The third begins with Lord Roberts taking command of British forces and launching the counteroffensive which took the major Boer towns.

Boer War Game Scale. One hexagon = approximately 90 kilometers. Each turn represents one month of operations. A corps represents two or three divisions plus corps echelon troops. A field force (division group) represents one or two reinforced divisions. A commando, brigade, or group represents 1-4000 fighting men.

boardgame.name: Dead End: The Living Dead Campaign Primer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Get ready for The Living Dead Campaign for Dead End!

This Primer paves the way for the upcoming Living Dead Campaign debuting October 31st, 2021.

The Dead End "Living Dead Campaign" takes your Novice survivors from their humble beginnings to the Heroic characters they will become over the course of the first year of the zombie apocalypse through a series of monthly adventures that tell the gripping tale of fear and survival in a world claimed by the dead.

See how the entire story plays out alongside the Dead End Community! Make it a shared experience between your group and others. Regale each other with death-defying tales and compare your shared experiences as the adventures happen!

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Clan Command Star
boardgame.description: The Clan Command Star includes the Dire Wolf, Summonder, Stormcrow, Mist Lynx, and Shadow Cat—no assembly required—along with five MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Command Lance
boardgame.description: The Inner Sphere Command Lance includes the iconic Marauder, Archer, Valkyrie, and Stinger - no assembly required! - along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike Action!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Clan Heavy Striker Star
boardgame.description: The Clan Heavy Striker Star includes the Gargoyle, Hellbringer, Mad Dog, Ice Ferret, and Viper -no assembly required- along with five MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Battle Lance
boardgame.description: The Inner Sphere Battle Lance includes the much-loved Warhammer, Rifleman, Phoenix Hawk, and Wasp - no assembly required - along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Direct Fire Lance
boardgame.description: The Inner Sphere Direct Fire Lance includes the iconic Atlas, Crusader, Marauder II and Orion - no assembly required! - along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike Action!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Clan Heavy Battle Star
boardgame.description: Unleash the Clan Heavy Battle Star on your enemies! Turkina, Kingfisher, Huntsman, Ebon Jaguar, and Crossbow—no assembly required—along with five MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Striker Lance
boardgame.description: The Inner Sphere Striker Lance includes the iconic Black Jack, Wolfhound, Jenner, and Panther - no assembly required - along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Star Fighters: Rapid Fire
boardgame.description:
Star Fighters: Rapid Fire combines the excitement of real-time dice rolling with tactical starship combat. Each player hops into the cockpit of their own starfighter and duels it out in a dog fight to prove who is the superior pilot. The game plays in multiple modes 1 vs 1, 3 player free-for-all, 2 vs 2, or a solo mode where a single starfighter attacks an orbital space station.

In the real-time phase all players roll and re-roll their command dice simultaneously, and assign them to the various functions of their starfighter. When a player has fully charged systems and is ready to act they may end the real-time phase by hitting the big red button and yelling, “Fire!” This means all players must cease rolling and allocating dice and move to the tactical phase.

In the tactical phase players then alternate activating the systems they have charged. This allows them to fire torpedoes or lasers at the enemy, manoeuvre around the map, adjust their shields, and other actions unique to their chosen starfighter.

Players must balance the pressure of real-time play while making good tactical and strategic decisions. The game only ends when one starfighter is destroyed. The pilot that hits the finishing blow gets all the glory and is the winner.

boardgame.name: China's Navy: Ships and Aircraft of the People's Republic of China, 1955 - 2021
boardgame.description:
China’s Navy lists the ships and aircraft used by the People’s Liberation Army Navy and Air Force and Chinese Coast Guard, in service between 1955 and the present day. It is designed as a sourcebook for Harpoon, fifth edition, but it can also be used as a general reference.

In China’s Navy, we don't pay as much attention to dimensions and propulsion plants, but do provide the game-related data you need, i.e., damage points, combat system ratings, and so on, along with ships’ sensors and weapons.

Organized as a collection of annexes, Annexes A and B provide statistics on ships and aircraft respectively as first built, and any modifications over time, sometimes many times. Annexes C and on give detailed weapons and sensors characteristics, including guns, missiles, antisubmarine weapons, torpedoes, mines, airborne ordnance, radars, sonars, and data links, with all the information needed to use them in a Harpoon scenario.

The book also provides information on land-based surface-to-air missiles and coastal defense missiles and their battery organization. Supplemental annexes list ship classifications and factors used to convert weapons and sensor information into game data.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Harpoon V: Modern Tactical Naval Combat 1955 - 2020

boardgame.name: F.C.M.T.: Fighter, Cleric, Magic User, Thief
boardgame.description:
A competitive, press-your-luck dungeon delver. FCMT is set in a magical dungeoneering competition where each of the legendary RPG classes will compete to determine who is the greatest adventuring class ever.

Players will face dangerous encounters, seek loot and weigh risk in an attempt to win dungeon tokens. These tokens are turned into dungeon gems. The first player to collect 3 dungeon gems is the winner.

FCMT uses the novel Fate Deck system for determining encounter outcomes. Instead of rolling dice, players draw fate cards that can be fueled by resources to increase their chance of success.

A new dungeon is created before each game by placing out a grid of face-down dungeon cards. Players progress through the dungeon by peeking at cards, revealing cards and trying to overcome the challenges they encounter.

By overcoming these challenges, which include traps, monsters and more, players will be rewarded with dungeon tokens. Each time a player earns 5 tokens, they are awarded a dungeon gem.

As soon as a player has 3 of these gems, they are declared the winner and the greatest dungeon delver of all time.

boardgame.name: Deep Rock Galactic: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
In Deep Rock Galactic: The Board Game, an authorized tabletop game adaption of the popular computer game, players take the roles of up to four dwarf miners in space: the Scout, the Engineer, the Gunner, and the Driller. Players must work together to mine precious minerals deep below the surface of a hostile planet where indigenous insectoid predators — the Glyphids — await, aggressively defending their caves against the intruders. Will your team be able to meet the mineral quota set by the company, or will you all end up as dinner for the Glyphids?

Players move around the board while throwing dice to fight monsters and mine rare minerals in order to escape in time with the required amount of minerals needed to win the current mission.

boardgame.name: Caers & Crannogs (Issue 1 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Caers & Crannogs is a zine for the NSR adventure game Cairn. Cairn is produced by Yochai Gal and is based on the games, Into the Odd and Knave. This zine seeks to present additional rules, alternative rules, new items and spells, new backgrounds and loadouts, settings, potential adventures, and lots and lots of random tables. Issue #1 and the next few to come will focus on THE OTHERWORLD, an Iron Age Celtic world of the fair-folk.

boardgame.name: Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 10
boardgame.description:
Inc0gn1t0 is a threat unlike any you've faced. Their identity and location are unknown, as are their demands. What is know is that they've hacked into networks across the city and we've found traces of a bomb that has some sort of remote access code. Can you stop them in time?

In this new expansion pack for Hostage Negotiator, you must deal with Inc0gn1t0's reign of terror across the city while trying to decrypt the code for the bomb. The more hostages you save the more time you buy for the decryption, but is it enough?

—description from the publisher

This Abductor pack is a 15 card expansion compatible with both Hostage Negotiator and Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave.

NOTE: It's a completely redesigned Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 10 and it's entirely different mechanically speaking.

boardgame.name: Hansel vs. Gretel: Feywild Civil War
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This nuts (crazy and gastronimically-disputed) domain of delight not far away from Prismeer is but a semblance of its former glory: after defeating the witch who tried to devour them, Hansel and Gretel ruled for long wisely (or so they said)... Until strife appeared, sown by a foreign pirate, throwing the siblings into a bitter dispute and the domain in disarray! Now three realms carved from within try to dominate and show which cake or recipe is better. Backstabbing, intrigue, pranks, absurd, and politically-mysterious events befall! The history, current state, features of the domain are (reliantly, I think) narrated here, along with a trip you will be sent in by means of which you will experience in an adventure what all of this nonsense is about. What will you find here? This crazy domain of delight, an adventure, maps and Images! A minor magic item, and a monster as well, as if that were not enough. More you want? How ambitious... like the lands now rulers, I must say. Your are this apt to govern here... Will you.. survive?
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Dungeon Encounters
boardgame.description: Dungeon Encounters is a unique dungeon exploration RPG in which you lead an expedition to chart the depths of an otherworldly labyrinth. Plan and prepare to overcome numerous obstacles, solve puzzles, and defeat monsters.

boardgame.name: Vapor World: Over the Mind
boardgame.description:
Vapor World is an action-adventure game that unfolds the inner world.
Explore the vast inner world to uncover hidden secrets and difficulties.
Vapor World immerses the player through beautiful illustrations and challenging battles.

boardgame.name: Don't You Forget About Me
boardgame.description:
From product listing:
The heroes are on their last day of a recruitment workshop at the prestigious Tsygan Intergalactic Boarding School (TIBS). To their surprise, they are under investigation by Star Shield (due to their involvement in the events of Exchange Student 0-2) and confined to detention at the J Bender Analog Library. Unknown to them, the library has other visitors from the Droid Authority. The droids intent: steal an ancient book of magic from the library's Brecken Vale wing. A battle soon erupts between TIBS security forces and the droid intruders with the heroes caught in the middle!

What is the true objective of the Droid Authority? Can Star Shield be trusted? And what is the truth about Nadic energy? These questions will weigh heavy on the heroes as they are presented with a choice that will change their lives (and possibly the galaxy) forever.

boardgame.name: Disciples: Liberation
boardgame.description: Disciples: Liberation is a mature, dark fantasy strategy RPG with tactical turn-based combat. Liberate the land of Nevendaar and uncover the endless stories hidden within this richly detailed world where every decision has a consequence, and every wrong move could be deadly.

boardgame.name: THE iDOL MASTER: Starlit Season
THE iDOLM@STER: Starlit Season
THE iDOLMASTER: Starlit Season
boardgame.description: "You," a producer of the talent agency 765 Production, have returned to Japan from an overseas training program.

boardgame.name: Mojee
boardgame.description:
Players receive nine cards of one color in their hand. They must place their cards in the same order as the story board cards. However, they can only place their cards on other players stacks.

Once all players have their cards, play begins simultaneously as each player tries to play their cards in the correct order and stacks. Once a player is out of cards, play stops and the stacks are checked.

Players win if the cards were played without mistakes and you have the least number of cards.

Players can also make up their own master stories or play the game without referring to the master set to make the game harder.

boardgame.name: Bamboo
boardgame.description:
The samurai train their mental strength by filling columns and/or rows of bamboo sticks with numbers to trigger point scores.

Bamboo is a dice game in which players must first collect symbols to be thrown before they can enter them in the scoring table. If a player succeeds in filling a row or column, then this row is scored by ALL players. The more points are awarded the more different symbols are entered there. But not all rows and columns are scored, so the players have to keep an eye on what the other players are doing.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Catwalk
boardgame.description:
The players have to move their cat from the starting field to the target field and walk around their territory.

Catwalk is a dice game in which the players have to walk along their territory. According to the result of the dice, you can move to fields in the territory and thus get closer to the goal. The player who does this first wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Beta Cards from Arkham Night 2020
boardgame.description:
These Beta Cards were designed at Arkham Night, 2020.

Include 2 cards.

Guard Dog (Level 2)
[Fast] Exhaust Guard Dog: Engage an enemy at your location. That enemy attacks you.
[Reaction] When an enemy attack deals damage or horror to Guard Dog: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

Flashlight (Level 3)
Uses (4 supplies).
[Reaction] When you perform a skill test while investigating
or attempting to evade, spend 1 supply: This test gets
–2 difficulty.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

boardgame.name: Loki
boardgame.description:
Loki is the first Play-to-Role game ever created. Play through three different card games with your friends (push-your-luck, bluffing and memory) and dive into a mystical Norse atmosphere.

While you play, your actions and results will determine your fate as a character, and you will be able to start the fourth module, an immersive Role Playing adventure! The card games are designed to create a vibrant, thrilling and engaging atmosphere between players. Each participant will compete against the others or in team, depending on the card game.

Asgard is a bluffing game where players must act as a Norse deity while bluffing to stay undercoven. The last one remaining alive wins the match.
Omen is a push-your-luck & memory game where players place bets to guess the number of cards on the board. Omen cards act as a jolly and can turn luck and memory against everybody.
Valhalla is a combat game where players compete against each other and against monsters to remain the last man standing in the arena.

Once the games are complete, the results and the points obtained by the players, together, form the traits of their characers in Mask of Loki, the Role-playing game that acts as a forth module. The game comes with a handy game manual explaining the rules: Mask of Loki, in fact, is a very simple game (it takes half an hour to be mastered) that rewards cooperative play and awards poor luck in the previous character creation session.

Hours of funny, thrilling and amazing adventures in the Norse society are waiting for you. Dive into Loki and show everybody what you are made of!

boardgame.name: Meanwhile, at the Con....
boardgame.description:
Meanwhile at the Con is a fast paced hectic drafting game to create the best booth at the Convention!

Players draft 5 cards each round. After drafting, each player adds cards to their tableau to build their booth, or attracts meeples from the convention through marketing cards and generates income in various ways. The player with the most money at the end of 5 rounds wins the game!

Through clever drafting, players can choose to sell either Comic Books, Collectible Toys or Board Games at their booth and build on their quality more. The better the quality, the higher the price.

Hire the right staff for your team and make sure you don't forget your marketing. Fans and customers go to the best booths with the best marketing. Start a craze with the cosplayers or even go as far as creating your own movie based on the game or comic book at your booth!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Imperio
boardgame.description:
Dreams, strategy and action ... this is how an Empire is created. Invest in properties and companies, accumulating wealth and doing business around the world, with this strategy game that will make you a millionaire.

Imperio ("Empire") is a board game, in which each player will try to build their own business empire. Inspired by the market economy, Imperio proposes to simulate the economic growth of people in the real world, through the purchase of goods in any of the 34 cities of the planisphere.

You will be able to acquire houses, buildings, restaurants and hotels or set up your own factory to sell products all over the planet and manage them by moving with your own plane. You can even have your own casino, while increasing your economic power. These goods can be purchased in any of the 34 cities in which the planisphere is divided, while you move along the path of the board with your avatar. Your profession can also help in this exciting enrichment career. The acquisition of new cities will allow you to increase the number of goods at your disposal, giving you greater chances of winning the game.

Although the objective is common to all players, the strategy is their own, so taking into account market conditions, at any time during the game, you can change your strategy to win the game. The first player to meet the goal of $ 1,000,000 wins the game.

The players move along the track and advance to the position indicated by the dice. Once the city is acquired, the player has the right to collect a rent for it and can additionally invest in different goods to increase the rent. Investments can be real estate such as houses, buildings and towers with a different value for each one, both for the purchase and the income obtained. Another type of investment can be in businesses such as hotels and restaurants, which have a variable income or a casino that, being the most expensive, can be acquired when there is already capital, but the profit obtained is quite high when the players fall into that town. And finally another type of investment is the acquisition of factories that allows players to buy inputs and sell products to the rest of the players.

Market conditions may vary throughout the game and may make it necessary to modify the strategy. Likewise, these changes also allow obtaining high dividends for those who can take advantage of them.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monos en la Selva
boardgame.description:
Monos en la Selva is a game for 2 to 5 players where each one will represent a Carayá monkey, a native of South America with the ecosystem of the Misionera jungle.

Players must play cards to move through the jungle and steal resources from the trees and be the player who steals the most fruits from their daily diet. The player who scores the most points at the end of the day will be the winner.

Each turn, a player:

play a card and executes its action
movement
fauna help (special action in the same tile)
monkey fight or branches shaking (all players get involved)

collects the corresponding resource from the tile
takes a new resource from the bag and put it in the empty space
takes a new card to end their turn with 3 cards in hand


The game end is triggered when the deck is empty or the resource bag is empty and 60% of the tiles are empty. Players do their last two actions and the game finishes.

Resources give points according to the scoring card of each player. The player with the most points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Martha is Dead
boardgame.description:
Martha Is Dead is a dark first-person psychological thriller, set in 1944 Italy, that blurs the lines between reality, superstition and the tragedy of war.

Source: The Publisher Website.
boardgame.videogameversion: Xbox One / Series X/S downloadable edition

boardgame.name: ASL Action Pack #17: Oktoberfest XXXV
boardgame.description:
Action Pack #17 is an expansion to the Advanced Squad Leader series, created for ASL Oktoberfest (ASLOK), held each October.

This year's edition contains two maps (87,88) and 16 new scenarios ranging from WWII Pacific to the Korean conflict.

boardgame.name: Arcanon: gra karciana
boardgame.description:
Arcanon a card game is a proposition for novice players. Take a part in the Acumulatory Race and collect as many paradox charges as possible within a specific time.

Good, Strength, Beauty, Wisdom, Truth - the names of the domains that are supervised by five ministries in the O'vsemir universe. Right here in incessant maze of political intrigues lasts fight for the absolute power. Arcanon is strategical and tactical game that throws more light on the diamond of all fields of Wisdom - Magic.

Plan your actions and manage elements in a matrix to adapt to the constantly changing situation. Do, what all mages do, bluf, reiroll dice, make and break alliances and most importantly, don't get caught. Decide where you want to win and where to lose. Maybe you will lose all battles to win the war? Only here the price for victory, may be the bitter taste of failure.

boardgame.name: The Greatest Thieves in Lankhmar
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

A level 3 adventure DCC RPG boxed set!

From the most famous city in the history of fantasy comes a sword-and-sorcery adventure that only the best gamers will survive!

The Greatest Thieves in Lankhmar is a Dungeon Crawl Classics adventure that sends characters into the hot cellars beneath Thieves’ House, across the sooty rooftops of the City of Sevenscore Thousand Smokes, and on to a mad dash through the palace of the Overlord. This boxed set comes with everything you need to run an epic adventure over several sessions, whether you run it stand-alone or as part of an ongoing campaign.

When you open the box, you’ll be in the company of legends. The Greatest Thieves in Lankhmar was first run as a tournament at Gen Con 2019, where 20 nationally competitive teams competed over four fantastic days and three hard-fought rounds. Characters died alone, lost beneath Thieves’ House, as their torches burnt out, one by one. After 44% of tables experienced TPKs, and nearly 6 in 10 PCs were killed, one team survived to win the tournament. How will your players compare?

INSIDE THIS BOX YOU WILL FIND:

- A 68-page booklet containing the adventure
- A 20-page book of player handouts
- A 16-page player pack
- A 48-page judge’s pack
- A 12-page scoring sheet
- Die-cut Luck tokens for using Fleeting Luck at the table
- Four pages of die-cut rooftop chase tokens
- A huge 44” long rooftop chase map, to simulate the chase across the rooftops of Lankhmar
- Plus “Dicing With Death,” a complete stand-alone bonus adventure designed to be deployed when characters die in the main adventure

Officially licensed from the estate of Fritz Leiber.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Decimation: You or Them
boardgame.description:
2321: The largest city on the moon of Klathea
52-F is under attack as waves of alien ships
suddenly appear in the sky above it. You are
unable to even fire one proton blast before fire
rains down onto the city.

In this small 1-card game you are the military leader of the capital of Klathea 52-F.
Your task is to distribute the resources in a way that will defend the city, and destroy the attacking alien fleet.
To do this each turn you will be drawing a random colored cube, which you will have to assign to one of the city's military facilities.

There are three types of cubes, each with it's own use:
White cubes - are the raw materials needed to perform any action.
Red cubes - are the ammunition needed to destroy the attacking ships.
Blue cubes - allows you to strengthen the force field protecting the city, and heal the city itself when the force field is compromised.

These cubes will be placed on action spaces, which in turn form action rows.
Once an action row (compromising of action spaces of different colors) is full, you remove those cubes from the row and perform the actions linked to that action row.

After you place all of your cubes, the enemy gets a chance to attack you.
But the more damage you deal to them, the less firepower they have.

Defeat the second wave of aliens, and you win!
But let the city's health reach 0, and you are decimated...

boardgame.name: Atelier Sophie 2: The Alchemist of the Mysterious Dream
boardgame.description: The latest entry in the series follows the beloved alchemist, Sophie Neuenmuller

boardgame.name: Legacy of Old Rus
boardgame.description:
“Legacy of Old Rus” is a roll and write game that seeks to reproduce the feel of a full-fledged RPG.
There's a long legacy campaign consisting of multiple plot missions.

You can also play the game in the casual, "one-shot" mode.

Prepare your heroes for a challenging journey to Far Away Kingdoms.
Each player takes control of a unique hero. The game takes eight rounds. During each of these rounds, you roll four dice and use their results to receive magic items and explore the world of Far Away Kingdoms. You will also develop your hero's skills, use various items of equipment and unique abilities to your advantage. When exploring the world, you will visit many interesting places and meet different characters — friendly and hostile.
At the end of the game, the player who gained the most glory points wins.

-The demo play will be available on Essen 2021-

boardgame.name: Big Boss
مدير كبير (Moder Kaber)
boardgame.description:
In each round of Big Boss, one player will be the first Big Boss. The Big Boss will pull a random job card and announce it as a vacancy to other players. The other players will check their blue cards (job cards) and decide which one they will go with as their current job. Then, the Big Boss will take the players cards and shuffle them together so they wouldn’t know who played which card. Then, the Big Boss will put these cards in front of the job vacancy and ask the players to put down their qualification cards. Some of the qualification cards have positive effect and some have negative effects, depending on the job and/or the vacancy. Players can either put negative effect to their rivals or put a positive effect on themselves. Cards can be stacked in case one job has multiple positive andand/or negative effects. Then, the Big Boss will call everyone for an interview session. This is the discussion phase. The Big Boss will ask the players for their current job and why they think they would be the suitable candidates for this job. A clever player would use the negative effect that was put on him and twist it to be a positive effect for them. The game depends on persuasion skill after all. A taxi driver can be a minister if you know how to convince the Big Boss. Afterward, the Big Boss will choose the winner which will get points depending on the vacancy.

(Slightly abbreviated description from the designer)

boardgame.name: Spell & Learn
boardgame.description:
Points based spelling game for children where a throw of the dice determines word type (noun, verb, etc) and word length (3-7 letters) for all players. All players begin with 100 points and draw letter tiles from the same shared pile (letters are hidden) until one player completes a qualifying word. That player rings the bell and all action stops. The bell ringing player gets 2 points per letter of their qualifying word. Other players get one point per letter in their words and they lose one point for every unused letter. the player with the most points at the end of 10 rounds wins. There are provisions included for challenges and for making the game easier for younger children.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Empress of the Deep 3: Legacy of the Phoenix
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Empress of the Deep 3: Legacy of the Phoenix follows Empress Anna after the events of the second game in the series.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Animal Crossing New Horizons
boardgame.description: Players can enjoy island life in the world of Animal Crossing New Horizons. Instead of buying properties or paying rent, players collect resources (Bugs, Fish, Fossils, and Fruit). You can sell these resources for bells to buy decorations (which earn you Nook Miles) or complete Nook Miles cards to earn Nook Miles. Player with the most Nook Miles at the end of the game wins.

Battle against other players at your own pace in this free to play chill auto battler.

In Super Auto Pets you build a team from a lovable cast of animals who will fight for you. They each have unique abilites, so choose wisely who will join your team!

boardgame.name: The Masquerade Companion
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Behold the Burgeoning Darkness

As a thank you to World of Darkness enthusiasts, this
book contains:

Clan descriptions for the doomed Ravnos, the hunted Salubri, and the covetous Tzimisce
Rules for playing mortals and ghouls
Extensive new traits to expand your chronicles, from Discipline powers to clan-specific Advantages to Merits and Flaws

boardgame.name: Battletech: Alpine/Grasslands Battlemat
boardgame.description:
Each map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes a never-before published map for one of the following terrain:


Desert
Lunar
Alpine
Savannah


The secondary side also includes brand-new maps—designed to be used together—as featured in the soon-to-release BattleTech Map Pack: Grasslands. Each of the four BattleMast displays a unique Grasslands map on the back.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Bone Idiots
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Bone Idiots! A class for Mörk Borg! You play as some real doofus skeletons!

boardgame.name: I am PalaDONE with your Sh*t!
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The sight of a Jerusalem cross makes your bowels loosen faster than a Pear of Anguish. In the presence of a paladin you are consumed by the urge to upturn the wearer’s barrel heaume and shit in it, whether or not their head remains within. In fact, all displays of chivalric superiority and moral arrogance similarly inspire you to murder. Who the fuck do they think they are to judge you or anyone else in the dying world!?

boardgame.name: What? Do you have a Death Witch?
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A class and spellbook compatible with Mörk Borg

Death Witch is part of a larger zine scenario called The Wicker God. Some of this may be a spoiler for that adventure, so CAVEAT LECTOR! That said, if you're interested in playing a witch class and/or adding to the list of scared and unclean scrolls, well, here you go.

boardgame.name: The Wicker God
boardgame.description:
From the description:

From the forest it emerges, taller than the trees, its body a writhing, shifting mass of woven roots and branches that smell of petrichor and decay. The giant thing reaches out and snares a buck in its gnarled fingers, shoving the yowling creature into its maw. Faintly, you hear screams from behind its prison of living branches.

Light the torches!

The Wicker God is i-comen in

The Wicker God encounter is part of a larger zine scenario of the same name.

boardgame.name: Slapping Bastard
boardgame.description:
From the description:

An unarmed class compatible with Mörk Borg! They can't use scrolls or weapons, but their open hands hit like burlap sacks full of rocks. And the sound is so satisfying!

boardgame.name: The Marrow Bees & Osteopiarists
boardgame.description:
From the description:

What's that buzzing? I hear the Marrow Bees' honey is tasty and valuable.... if you can get to it. If they don't bore into your bones and you escape the Osteopiarists. It's risky, but oh, that marrow honey.

boardgame.name: The Emperor of Teeth
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Your party is starving and cold. Maybe there's something to eat in that cottage up ahead. Maybe you ARE what's to eat in that cottage up ahead. Let yourself in and find out.

boardgame.name: Jólakötturinn / Yule Cat
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A Hex-mas themed monster/god for those cold Icelandic nights! The Jólakötturinn stalks the Dying World devouring anyone caught wearing old and tattered clothes at Jól. So, basically everyone!

At 100 hp, it's unkillable (just like the real thing), but you know, you do you. It could be 50 or 35 or whatever you want. Have fun!

boardgame.name: Cloud of Sinners
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A cloud looms in the horizon, lamentations precede it.

Submit your players to a purity test by forcing them to fight their inner demons. Them being punsished for their sins may or may not have to do with their ability to fight or bargain with said demon, but you get the idea.

boardgame.name: Alchemy Stars
boardgame.description: Anime

boardgame.name: Arise of Awakener
boardgame.description: “Arise of Awakener is a single-player, open-map action role-playing game set in a fantasy world based upon medieval Europe.

boardgame.name: Far light 84
Farlight 84

武装都市

boardgame.name: Blue Reflection: Second Light
boardgame.description: With gorgeous translucent designs by Mel Kishida, as well as a story that depicts the youth of lifelike girls

boardgame.name: Touken Ranbu Warriors
boardgame.description: A Touken Ranbu and Warriors series collaboration as a much-anticipated 3D action game!

boardgame.name: Mondagor - Das Vermächtnis der Drachen (Windgeflüster-Version)
boardgame.description:
Back cover blurb

Mondagor - Eine Welt mit bewegter Geschichte, facettenreichen Kulturen, vielfältigen Magien und Schwertmeistern, die sich unermüdlich gegen die Fronten der Drachenarmeen werfen. In dieser Welt erheben sich jetzt uralte Mächte. Etwas geschieht mit den Völkern. Die Schöpfung bäumt sich gegen sie auf, will sie verändern - auf etwas vorbereiten: Erben werden auserwählt, das Vermächtnis der Drachen anzutreten.

Zwischen ewiger Versklavung und trügerischer Freiheit stehen nur noch wenige, gegen die Brut kämpfend, um die Westlichen Reiche endgültig zu befrieden.

Zu dieser letzten Allianz der Hoffnung gehören auch die Wanderer!

user comment (German)

boardgame.name: Anduin (Issue 60 - Apr 2000)
boardgame.description: Thema: Horror

boardgame.description:
In Sheep Sheep Hurra! we will get into the skin of a shepherd looking for a job in the region of Fuente Narváez (Spain). We will compete with other shepherds to gather 10 sheep in our flock.

Use your cards to prevent your opponents from achieving their goal.

A game for 2 to 6 players from 6 years old.

boardgame.name: Carrera de Mente: Cartas
boardgame.description:
A card version of the classic trivia game Carrera de Mente.

On this version players throw a coloured die to get a subject and then answer one of the questions on the card (according to the die result). If you get it correct, you can keep the card and get a new turn.

First player to score 10 cards wins.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Initiative Deck
boardgame.description:
Enhance your battlefield tactics by substituting the Initiative Deck for the standard Initiative roll. Poor initiative position awards stronger strategic and tactical opportunities which can make up for "bad luck."

The Initiative Deck is 65 cards of 5 suits of 13 cards each in a single tuck box with a rules booklet.

Includes rules for four ways to use the deck:


Alternate Initiative
Initiative Effects
Poker (four or five suits)
Drax (a popular Free World's League game)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Battlefield Support Deck
boardgame.description: Add new dimensions of warfare to your BattleTech games with the Battlefield Support Deck, which consolidates the popular Battlefield Support rules from BattleMech manual onto easy-to-use cards. 55 cards which include the rules needed by one side in tabletop play. Includes artillery, aerospace strikes, minefields, and other non-BattleMech tools of war. Out-strategize your opponents with a multitude of options at your fingertips!
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: The Apocalypsis Collection: Arcana Edition
boardgame.description:
The Apocalypsis Collection is the big box edition of three gorgeously remastered games (Nova Lux, Impendium, and Aedifex) composing an epic space opera beginning with the end of the universe. The Arcana edition of the Apocalypsis collection introduces a new Big Box table presence with beautifully remastered art, miniatures, components, and gameplay.

In Nova Lux, you will take charge of orphaned alien species that have escaped dying star systems in the wake of a galactic apocalypse. As entropy has increased to maximum, you will navigate the collapsing universe while collecting necessary resources to sustain biological life all while attempting to build an enclosed biosphere colony surrounding one of the last remaining stars. Once you do, you will need to satisfy the diverse requirements of your tenuous new galactic federation to ensure unity and hope for a new future. Manage resources, navigate the collapsing universe, build your biosphere engine, and race to establish your colony and satisfy your factions.

In Impendium, you will pick up immediately after the events of Nova Lux. As one of the leading factions of the newly founded Galactic Federation, you will set out to rebuild the universe and spread your power in the new galactic order. But be ware as you do, breaking the natural law of entropy, the mysterious void will take notice and seek to destroy everything that you have created. Recruit new factions to your cause and manage their loyalty, build new stars and colonies, manage resources, battle the void, and establish your power through diplomacy and war.

Finally in Aedifex you will see the universe from the void's perspective. Take on the role of an Architect of the Void. You will feed the machine that holds the fabric of existence together by cultivating the multiverse for it to consume. Meanwhile you will position yourself for dominance of the machine and ultimately dominion over existence itself. Aedifex is a deck-building game with unique player interactions, challenging decisions, and a perpetually evolving scoring mechanism.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Escape from Auschwitz (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
boardgame.description:
This fan, print and play scenario for T.I.M.E Stories takes the agents on a journey for recovering a report lost in the Auschwitz concentration camp in 1942. They take role of camp escapees, trying to restore the balance of history.

The story is based on real events. Despite the apparent topic, I'd say it's PG-15 due to strong language.

boardgame.name: Black Spear (RuneQuest)
boardgame.description:
“Know then, oh Prince, that in the Sea Season after the Battle of the Queens was Colymar’s Black Spear sent forth to rouse Argrath from his slumbers.”

An epic saga of the Hero Wars, festooned with heroquests and deep Gloranthan weirdness. Probably the strangest thing I’ve ever written. Designed as a follow-up to The Duel at Dangerford, but it also works as a stand-alone mini-campaign. Canonically set in Sea Season 1627, with suggestions at the back of the book for changing things around. Illustrated lavishly by Mike O’Connor: 50+ pictures, one or two songs, some poetry, not many stat-blocks.

Source: DriveThruRPG product page
tiny.cc/jc-blackspear

boardgame.name: The Islands of Ṡina Una
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bakunawa rose from the sea, her scaled and slick and massive form rising up over cities and mountains, her teeth glistening and her eyes filled with desire, and she opened her mouth wide. The moon, Mayari, looked on as the Celestial Eater grew closer and closer, stopped only when Haliya arrived and struck the great serpent with her sword. Haliya's mask reflected the warrior goddess' rage as she fought the serpent back into the sea, forcing it to retreat. It would only be a matter of time before an attempt on the moon's life would be made again, be it Bakunawa or one of the other Celestial Eaters. And as she laid to rest, she knew both herself and the mortal races would need to be ready.

The Islands of Sina Una is a new Campaign Setting for 5th Edition that pulls from precolonial mythology and culture of the Philippines. In the time since Bakunawa's last attack the mortal races that inhabit the island recover slowly as life goes on. While some do battle with the monsters that roam these lands, others work as intermediaries, communicating between spirits and deities to help protect and guide their people. And yet, there are still others who choose to align with the terrible Celestial Eaters, to destroy the moon and bring about the end of all things.

What role do you play in a world of mortals, spirits, and monsters?

boardgame.name: Player's Guide to the Contagion Chronicle
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Contagion has come; it’s ravaged the world and left you in its wake. The few who are left band together, along lines you never once thought you would agree to. When your enemy becomes the only friend you have left, you make do the best you can.

This book includes essays discussing how to combine multiple monster and supernatural types from the Chronicles of Darkness within a Contagion Chronicle game, including:


An FAQ that covers common rules from all the Chronicles game lines and how they interact.
A full explanation of how magic from Mage: The Awakening interacts with all other monster types.
Essays on banding together as groups, and joining monster-specific groups such as covenants, Orders, and courts.
An essay on sharing Merits, and new Merits to facilitate mixed character-type groups.

boardgame.name: Panic Attack! Scooby-Doo!
boardgame.description:
Scooby-Doo is trying to solve mysteries. A scary ghost gets in the way and does not let him move freely. Help Scooby evade the flaming ghost with the help of the scooby gang to be the winner.

In your turn you flip a location token to decide the location that the ghost appears, you then roll the die to move Scooby-Doo and if you land near a space with a hidden token you open it. If you land again near it, you take it. If it is a member of the scooby gang or a Scooby snack you use various abilities to win the game. If it is a monster, it gives you negative points depending of the color. Whoever has the most victory points when all the tokens are taken wins.

boardgame.name: Conquista
boardgame.description:
Conquista is a dice game in which the players conquer countries with the help of the right combination of dice. It is also possible to take over territories that have already been occupied, although this is more difficult. The winner is the player who takes over the most valuable lands overall.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Chonkers
boardgame.description:
Chonkers is an original game using a traditional deck of cards. Players play cards from their hand in an attempt to win cards from a central display which are dealt out at the beginning of the game. The won cards are combined with any cards left in hand. Hands are revealed. Best poker hand wins.

This is a light family-style card game comparable to Knizia's original Poker games found in Blazing Aces! Like those Knizia games, this is not a Poker variant, but an original game using poker rankings.

boardgame.name: RuneQuest Starter Set
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

A WORLD OF FANTASTIC MYTH & HEROIC ADVENTURE IN A BOX!

RuneQuest is a fantasy roleplaying game set in the world of Glorantha, played by two or more players and a single gamemaster. Players in RuneQuest are adventurers, heroes who must face the challenges laid before them by the gamemaster, who describes the world and its incredible inhabitants.

Adventurers are defined by their skills, passions, equipment, and magical abilities such as spells and mastery of the powerful Runes. They improve by successfully using the skills and abilities they attempt in play. Combat is dangerous and unpredictable. Even the mightiest can fall in battle, victim to a well-aimed blow, just as the most inexperienced peasant might bring down a giant or even a dragon, if they are lucky enough. Such is life in the world of Glorantha.

Beset by war, the heroes of Glorantha ready themselves for their greatest challenge, the looming threat of the Hero Wars, an apocalyptic battle that will shape the fate of the world for all of time. To show themselves worthy, heroes adventure and strive against Chaos and their former enemies, the Lunar Empire.

The RuneQuest Starter Set allows players to easily immerse themselves into Glorantha and its system, with ready-to-use characters and ready-to-play adventures allowing for many hours of play. There is no better way to learn about the game and world than this starter set.

INSIDE THIS BOX

Book 1: Rules: The basic rules for RuneQuest, providing everything you will need to get started on your heroic adventures.
Book 2: The World of Glorantha: This booklet contains background information about Glorantha, the mythical fantasy world of RuneQuest, and the city of Jonstown.
Book 3: SoloQuest: A solo adventure to teach the rules to beginning gamemasters and players, titled Battle at Dangerford.
Book 4: Adventures: Three adventures and adventure seeds for further adventures. Includes A Rough Landing, A Fire in the Darkness, and The Rainbow Mounds.
Ready-made Adventurers (14): Ready-to-use, pre-generated adventurers for you and your fellow players.
Blank Adventurer Sheets (4): Blank sheets for your use.
Handouts: A collection of references for use by players and gamemaster alike.
Maps: Three maps including the region around Jonstown, the city of Jonstown, and the Rainbow Mounds.
Roleplaying Dice: A set of six polyhedral dice suitable for roleplaying in RuneQuest.

boardgame.name: Zookeeper: an independent-play game for pre-schoolers
boardgame.description: A game with no reading or counting, let pre-schoolers play together. Draw a card and put it face up in front of you. On your next turn, draw a new card or bank those face-up cards. Draw an open cage card and return any un-banked cards to the discard pile. Play until you are out of cards. The person with the largest pile of banked cards wins.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Witch Ref
boardgame.description:
This 103-page issue is a Witch Reference (Ref).

From hidden covens to schools of magic to bubbling cauldrons to charms, wands, & amulets, witches enchant, cast spells, brew potions, scry mirrors, and read the signs of nature and supernatural.

This even has a tool to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results.

boardgame.name: Stony Fields
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Steep-sided hills dot this boulder-strewn plain, which is part of a desolate border between two kingdoms. The only travelers that frequent the Stony Fields are the smugglers and roving bandits based in Dimwood Refuge. Others crossing the Fields risks their lives. Aside from bandits and smugglers, the plain and the many caves hidden beneath its rocky surface are home to dangerous creatures. The trails that criss-cross the Stony Fields avoid hazardous locations like the Shadow Creeper Den and the Troglodyte Lair, but they also make tempting ambush sites. Those forced to spend the night in this land often use the Roadhouse Ruin as a campsite, and historians sometimes visit the Seared Field, the site of a significant battle. Everyone avoids the Bleakwater, the north edge of a vast swamp that stretches away to the south and west.

boardgame.name: Just Geomorphs #43
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Just Geomorphs bring more geomorphs to Dungeons in Blue! They include a mix of all corridor and room styles: 10-, 20- and 30-foot caverns and worked passages plus sewers and mines, all connecting an assortment of rooms, caves, chambers and caverns. Sets include GM and player versions of each geomorph, plus a map legend, one-third scale reference image, and a brief readme PDF. Just Geomorphs sets are also available in discount Triple Pack bundles.
