Sets include GM and player versions of each geomorph, plus a map legend, one-third scale reference image, and a brief readme PDF. Just Geomorphs sets are also available in discount Triple Pack bundles.

boardgame.name: Just Geomorphs #48
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Just Geomorphs bring more geomorphs to Dungeons in Blue! They include a mix of all corridor and room styles: 10-, 20- and 30-foot caverns and worked passages plus sewers and mines, all connecting an assortment of rooms, caves, chambers and caverns. Sets include GM and player versions of each geomorph, plus a map legend, one-third scale reference image, and a brief readme PDF. Just Geomorphs sets are also available in discount Triple Pack bundles.

boardgame.name: Long Runs #1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes you need to spread out when you're designing your dungeon. Dungeons in Blue Long Runs sets contain very long corridor runs with varied connections and tunnel styles. The goal of these tiles is to get from point A to point B with minimum fuss. They're ideal for creating level breaks without the need for stairs.

boardgame.name: Long Runs #2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes you need to spread out when you're designing your dungeon. Dungeons in Blue Long Runs sets contain very long corridor runs with varied connections and tunnel styles. The goal of these tiles is to get from point A to point B with minimum fuss. They're ideal for creating level breaks without the need for stairs.

boardgame.name: Long Runs #3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes you need to spread out when you're designing your dungeon. Dungeons in Blue Long Runs sets contain very long corridor runs with varied connections and tunnel styles. The goal of these tiles is to get from point A to point B with minimum fuss. They're ideal for creating level breaks without the need for stairs.

boardgame.name: Rosette Diceless Companion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Based on our years of running Rosette Diceless, we've compiled new optional rules, advice for Narrators and players, and new character options into a single volume for easy reference. There are a bunch of original pieces of advice and proposed rules as well as revised versions of articles previously posted as supplemental material on the Rosette website.

If Rosette Diceless is working for your game, this book will help it run even better; and if you aren't sure if Diceless is working for you, this book will hopefully address any issues you have!

boardgame.name: Free at Last
boardgame.description:
Free at Last is a game for 2-6 players. Players take on the role of civil rights organizations (SNCC, CORE, etc) as they fight for equal rights and the end of segregation in the Deep South, circa 1960-1964. It is not about Washington, DC, but the efforts of the people on the spot, whether that is Claiborne Parish, Louisiana or Mobile, Alabama.

Free at Last is a card-driven game in which each card has a number (used to activate special individuals) and an event, but uniquely, the color of the number also matters and affects the type of project (voting rights, accommodations, school desegregation) that can be attempted.

Multiple-length versions can be played: 3 turns (ending with the Freedom Rides), 6 turns (ending with the March on Washington), or a 9 turn game covering this entire period in American history.

Note: This game bears the same name and designer as Free at Last, but the designs each stand on their own, with this game being for 2-6 players while the previous game was for only two players.

boardgame.name: Chromatic Dungeons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Chromatic Dungeons is an OSR clone meant to emulate the feel of the 70s/80s era gaming experience while applying modern sensibilities and game design philosophies. These include:


Streamlined and fast play
Empowerment for rulings over getting stuck on rules (do what your table wants to do)
Mechanically lethal system encouraging creative problem solving
Ancestries and customizable heritages offer flexibility and get out of worn out racial stereotypes
Inclusive representation.
Ascending AC and intuitive ability check mechanic.
Easily compatible with adventures from the 70s/80s with minimal conversion needed.

boardgame.name: Chromatic Dungeons Basic Rules
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Chromatic Dungeons Basic Rules is the slimmed down, basic ruleset for the Chromatic Dungeons game. What is Chromatic Dungeons? An OSR clone of TSR era gaming modified with cleaner, more intuitive rules when necessary, and presented to be inclusive of all types of gamers of this great hobby!

boardgame.name: Chromatic Dungeons Basic Set: Monsters & Treasure
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This product is for the BASIC rules version of Chromatic Dungeons Monsters & Treasures book. The full bestiary and a trove of magical items are part of the full Chromatic Dungeons Rulebook.

boardgame.name: The Gnoll Sage (Issue 1 - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
The first issue of The Gnoll Sage!

In this issue, Fleabag the gnoll explorer reveals the details of the horrific Mrav Covjecka!

That is followed by a quick adventure featuring said Mrav, and then sections for new magical items, spells, NPCs, and some Dungeon Humor to lighten the mood!

boardgame.name: The Gnoll Sage (Issue 2 - Oct 2021)
boardgame.description:
The second issue of The Gnoll Sage!

In this issue, Fleabag the gnoll explorer explains the time they met the Animist, and details out all of the class features!

The Animist is a new class for your OSR games. While designed for the Chromatic Dungeons game, this class can easily be modified for all or most OSR games.

boardgame.name: The Gnoll Sage (Issue 3 - Oct 2021)
boardgame.description:
In the third issue of The Gnoll Sage:

Fleabag details out their experiences with the Mushropod, and gives you a wealth of information about their ecology. A short adventure featuring the Mushropod follows, and of course the staple sections of new magic items, spells, and NPCs follows. More Dungeon Humor is also included, as well as the regular State of the Business feature!

boardgame.name: The Gnoll Sage (Issue 4 - Oct 2021)
boardgame.description:
In this fourth issue of The Gnoll Sage, Fleabag details out the time they ran into the mystic psionist class!

While this class is designed for the Chromatic Dungeons game, it is compatible with all or most OSR rulesets with little or no modification.

boardgame.name: The Gnoll Sage (Issue 5 - Oct 2021)
boardgame.description:
In this fifth double sized issue of The Gnoll Sage, Fleabag tells you how orcs are so much more than mere cannon fodder, detailing out several unique clans!

While this class is designed for the Chromatic Dungeons game, it is compatible with all or most OSR rulesets with little or no modification.

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 282 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table
Issue 282

The Most Tragic Game

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 283 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table
Issue 283

E-Pee Riders

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 284 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table
Issue 284

End Game

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 285 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table
Issue 285

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 286 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table
Issue 286

My Neighbor Beholder

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 287 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table
Issue 287

The Gamemaster: Let the dice fall where they may

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table (Midnight Special)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This brings five special issues of Knights of the Dinner Table that have been out of print for over 15 years screaming down the tracks. All between two covers and back in print.

User summary:

Includes material previously published in:

Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Origins '03 Special - Jun 2003)
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Origins '04 Special - Jun 2004)
KODT Diamond Exclusive issue 1
KODT Diamond Exclusive issue 2
KODT Diamond Exclusive issue 3

boardgame.name: Dungeons & Dragons Rules Expansion Gift Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Expanded Rules. Expanded Foes. Expanded Adventure! Crafted for DMs and players alike, this collection brings together three Dungeons & Dragons rules expansion books in one gift set, complete with a beautiful Dungeon Master’s screen.

User summary:

Includes these previously-published products gathered into a slipcase:


Tasha's Cauldron of Everything
Xanathar's Guide to Everything
Monsters of the Multiverse
DM Screen

boardgame.name: Veggie Battle
boardgame.description:
Veggie Battle is a hidden goal, tile drafting and placement game for 2-4 players. You play the role of one of several neighbors working in shared community gardens, scheming against each other to win the coveted "Gardener of the Year" award.

Each player receives four Goals for the game, two of which are shared while the other two remain hidden. Players also receive three Tool cards that allow them to take actions that are otherwise outside of normal gardening etiquette.

The gardens are represented by four 3x3 grids. Players take turns drafting tiles representing one of seven different veggies and placing them in an unoccupied slot in any garden. Once all gardens are completely planted, players assign one goal to each garden and calculate their harvest to determine who scored the veggie victory.

"--description from the designer"

boardgame.name: Paladin Schmaladin Order
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Paladin Schmaladin Order is a supplement for Mörk Borg which contains lore and rumors about the Order and the Högmod Cathedral in what once was Südglans. The supplement can be used as an adventure seed or as inspiration to throw into your campaign.

boardgame.name: Barrowcleft
boardgame.description:
From the description:

On the far banks of the River Dosk, the pastures, orchards, and open fields stretch away into the distance. Each farm glows with the sickly light of the radiant energy that allows plants to grow even in this night-shrouded world.  This is Barrowcleft, home to the farmers and labourers who toil for their whole lives in the near-barren soil and grow strange in their rural isolation. 

This unofficial, fan-made district guide helps you run games of Blades in the Dark set in the sprawling agricultural hinterland of Doskvol — where the terrors of the Deathlands lurk just behind the back fence of the fields, and criminal gangs camp in the craggy hills and dense woods away from prying eyes.

It contains:

- The Landscape of Barrowcleft — Tables to generate locations in the district for your crew’s scores
- Claims map — Develop your own camp and cover operation as a criminal gang based in Doskvol’s rural hinterland
- Opportunities — Make some coin among the villages and farms
- Bees in the dark — a honey heist that pits the crew against the Ministry of Preservation as they steal a valuable cargo of beehives and race them to a buyer in the city

boardgame.name: Hide & Seek
boardgame.description:
One player takes on the role of the cat, the other of the mice. The cat tries to capture the mice before the mice escape. The game uses hidden movement and bluffing mechanisms.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Curse of Cthulhu
boardgame.description: Bluffing game for 2 players. Depending on the version players take turns guessing which in hand the other player is holding the Cthulhu token and decreasing the opponent's sanity points

boardgame.name: Caral
boardgame.description:
In Caral all players take on the role of master builders, creating pyramids in a rhythmic cycle of years while influencing the duration of each cycle. The unique progress rhythm allows players to put pressure on each other. Will you master the well-interlocked mechanics in order to win?

During the game we find ourselves over 4500 years in the past, competing against each other and experiencing ancient Caral in its heyday.

Caral will surprise you with a fresh gaming experience! What starts out very simple, develops surprisingly complex. For example, Alpacas and resource cards allow you more flexibility on the spiral path. But sacrificing valuable cards in the annual ceremony can give you great advantages over fellow players. It's all a matter of tactics!

Make Caral your very own game with different modules that allow you to increase game complexity as desired (chronicle style)—turning Caral into a game you can enjoy with your family and with experienced gamers alike.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cábula
boardgame.description:
Cabula is a game full of magic, you will take the role of a wizard in a competition to reach the maximum power (represented by star cards).

Whoever is able to collect five stars will become the best wizard, the rest will fail in their mission. You have to use wisely the magical creatures, dragons, cyclops, minotaurs and krakens cards, to sabotage the strategies of the other wizards, but you have to be very careful with the beasts of the other participants, they will be used for the same purpose to lose power and ruin all the strategies.

You can also use the different spell cards and try to avoid the curse cards.

A hand management card game in which the first one to get 5 stars down wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 大正吉凶なし (No luck in Taisho)
boardgame.description:
Players each receive a rad. In each round, players play a card face down and choose either to challenge or clear it. Once every player has chosen, challengers turn their card face up and score UNLESS 1 child card is shown, in which case the child scores points.

Cards are then discarded and new cards dealt until the deck is finished. The player with the most points wins.

大吉は大当たり、中吉はうれしい、小吉は救われる。
それより最も重要なのは、末吉の命運！
運勢を小僧に奪われないよう、タイミングを見計らって、おみくじを引け！

boardgame.name: Mörky Waters
boardgame.description: An adventure for Mörk Borg

boardgame.name: The Paladins of the Unclean Light
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A couple of disgusting NPCs liders of a horrid cult.

boardgame.name: Pictures: Orange
boardgame.description:
An expansion for Pictures by Daniela and Christian Stöhr for up to 6 players. (14+ years, playtime approx. 30 min)

Pictures: Orange is the first major expansion for Pictures, the award-winning creative family game. Two new material sets and 55 cards with 110 new photos provide more variety and lasting fun.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 86: Tabannusi, Abomination, Imperial Settlers Roll & Write - Top 5 T-Games That Aren’t The T-Games

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Pictures Orange Publisher: PD-Verlag Language(s): English

boardgame.name: ZombieZone (Postcard edition)
boardgame.description:
The year 2020. It's been 5 years since the zombie uprising that we now refer to as "Zombie Summer". You could say that we've since adapted to living with the undead… All you need to do is stay indoors, keep your weapons close, and don't trust anyone or anything. But as humans, we are a greedy species, and we found a way to make money off of the zombies. And that is where the ZombieZone comes in.

ZombieZone (Postcard edition) is a battle arena where 4 humans and 4 zombies will fight to the death… on live television. From the safety of our homes, we watch the destruction unfold, placing bets on or against mankind. And some of us will even risk our own lives for a chance at fame and fortune. Will the money hungry-humans, armed with a shotgun and a brain make it out alive? Or will the flesh-hungry Zombies multiply and take them over?


ZombieZone (Postcard edition) is a head to head strategic battle for survival of humans vs. zombies. 2 players each use coins and dice to maneuver around a gridded parking lot game board. Humans are armed with a shotgun for ultimate zombie destruction, and zombies spread quickly by taking over the humans (flipping the coin over to become a zombie). The last one standing wins.

If you are looking for the full edition, see here. The full game has a larger board, more units, bombs, a second win condition, and a lot more space to do what you need to do.

boardgame.name: Neko Harbour: The Card Game – King George Island Promo
boardgame.description:
Debuted at ESSEN 2021

Are you planning to visit King George Island? With this card you can explore the amazing viewpoint in Antarctica.

This card works the same as other Attraction card. Shuffle with other Attraction cards during setup.

During the game, if you are the only ship who visits the viewpoint, you will score for each your ship in game. Each ship you have in game scores 1 point. If you are not the only ship in the viewpoint, you get a Captain card instead.

When the game ends, the player whose ships add up to the highest total levels scores the full amount of VPs indicated on total ships level at their harbour.

In same fashion, The player with the 2nd highest total levels wins half of the VPs (rounded down) from the total ships level in their harbour, and 3rd place half again, etc. In the event of a tie, the player who has a ship docked at the higher level wins.

For example: You are the 1st total level at King George Island, you score full amount Penguin Points from the total ships level in your harbour. You have 3 ships stayed in the harbour, specifically their levels are 3, 4 and 6. Thus, you will score 13 points (3+4+6). In case you are the 2nd in the viewpoints, you only score 6 points (13/2 rounded down.)

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Friedrich Deluxe Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Friedrich-de-Luxe-expansion includes:


24 plastic box lids for the generals
24 lables for the lids
120 wooden blocks
1 set of Tactical Cards with a grey pattern
1 set of rules


The plastic box lids have the size of a flat matchbox. They come in different colours; dark blue for Prussia, red for France, etc.

The labels have a similar look as the labels of the generals.

The wooden blocks are 11 x 11 x 6 mm in size. They come in the following colours:


32 dark blue
12 light blue
16 dark green
4 light green
30 white
6 yellow
20 red


The expansion also includes a fifth set of Tactical Cards. This is useful when players run out of cards, which can happen when Prussia succeeds in avoiding battle for a long time.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
Comes without box, directly from the Berlin designer/publisher. Attention: you can also get the Maria deLuxe (specify after your order) for the same price, or both for 25 €!
Shipping: germany: 3 € Rest of the World 5 €, tracking 8 €
Buyer pays shipping, I can ship in the brown box it comes in and shipping should be pretty cheap. Will ship using pirateship.

boardgame.name: Maria: De Luxe Erweiterung
Maria: De Luxe Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Maria-de-Luxe-expansion includes:


20 plastic box lids for the generals
20 lables for the lids
120 wooden blocks
1 set of rules


The plastic box lids have the size of a flat matchbox. They come in different colours; dark blue for Prussia, red for France, etc.

The labels have a similar look as the labels of the generals.

The wooden blocks are 11 x 11 x 6 mm in size. They come in the following colours:


22 dark blue
28 white
26 red
14 grey
5 orange
5 dark green
20 nature wood


But what are the nature wood blocks for?

Quite simple: The coloured blocks represent the starting troops of a power. Should a power recruit beyond its starting strength, it will use the nature wood blocks. (As a reminder: In Maria there is no troops maximum.)

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Glatisant (Issue #20)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the 20th issue of The Glatisant, Questing Beast’s free monthly newsletter.

Reviews
News
History
Theory and Advice
Worldbuilding
Interviews
Rules and Game Design
Art

boardgame.name: Outbreak
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Never Say Die
The zombie apocalypse arrived this morning and the world is filled with the quick and the undead. The players are booking it out of town on a bus, but they soon find themselves stranded in the middle of nowhere. Night is falling, but maybe they can find refuge in that creepy old house in the woods?

Outbreak is a gut-wrenching scenario inspired by the zombie films and shows we know and love. It is designed to be played in a single evening and requires the ELEMENTAL Complete Guide. There are seven pre-generated characters to choose from, and each is presented in “living” and “zombie” form!

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Shadow Lord (Spears & Spells)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This adventure was written for the Spears & Spells game published by Kabouter Games. It is specifically designed as a “one-shot” adventure, providing approximately 4 hours of entertainment for players with beginning characters.

Adventure Background
High in the mountains of Kalvar Tel is a remote fastness where Shalazar the Plaguemaster was imprisoned. In his day — a millennium ago — Shalazar’s hordes of voracious undead swept across the land, and for a brief time he set himself up as a conquering emperor. Before he could achieve his dreams of conquest, he was betrayed, brought low by a band of adventurers, and transported in magical chains to a craggy cavern where he now rests. The guardians of Shalazar’s prison sealed the doors and departed for settled lands, certain the threat was past and their task complete.

But it was not to be, for Shalazar had other plans.

Shalazar’s dream was to transform himself into a lich, an undead sorcerer so powerful that death itself was no barrier to his magical might. Powerful though he was, his limited access to proper alchemical apparatus and magical ingredients, combined with an impatient urge to take revenge on his captors, caused him to make a critical error in the ritual. He gained the unlife he so keenly craved, but it was one bereft of magical power, and that drove Shalazar insane with grief and regret.

It is said his notebooks remain, detailing the steps necessary to lichdom. They must be worth a king’s ransom — either to a magician who covets eternal life or to those who wish such knowledge to remain forbidden...

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Shadow Lord (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Originally written for the the Spears & Spells game published by Kabouter Games, this adventure has been adapted for the Fifth Edition of the world’s most popular roleplaying game.

It is specifically designed as a “one-shot” adventure in the Old School Revival (OSR) tradition, providing approximately 4 hours of entertainment for 4 to 6 players with characters of 5th level.

Adventure Background
High in the mountains of Kalvar Tel is a remote fastness where Shalazar the Plaguemaster was imprisoned. In his day — a millennium ago — Shalazar’s hordes of voracious undead swept across the land, and for a brief time he set himself up as a conquering emperor. Before he could achieve his dreams of conquest, he was betrayed, brought low by a band of adventurers, and transported in magical chains to a craggy cavern where he now rests. The guardians of Shalazar’s prison sealed the doors and departed for settled lands, certain the threat was past and their task complete.

But it was not to be, for Shalazar had other plans.

Shalazar’s dream was to transform himself into a lich, an undead sorcerer so powerful that death itself was no barrier to his magical might. Powerful though he was, his limited access to proper alchemical apparatus and magical ingredients, combined with an impatient urge to take revenge on his captors, caused him to make a critical error in the ritual. He gained the unlife he so keenly craved, but it was one bereft of magical power, and that drove Shalazar insane with grief and regret.

It is said his notebooks remain, detailing the steps necessary to lichdom. They must be worth a king’s ransom — either to a magician who covets eternal life or to those who wish such knowledge to remain forbidden...

boardgame.name: Special Ops
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Very Particular Set of Skills

When your soldier is ready to get their hands dirty with the kinds of bare-knuckled mayhem and search-and-destroy missions that ordinary grunts just can't handle, you'll be ready to rumble with over a dozen fantastic Special Ops techniques! Master Core Thunder and Cyber Shroud integral arsenals, swap out gear boosts for special ops training like infiltration specialist, and engage combat subroutines with the Strife Recognition Drive and Adaptive Strife Loader feats!

boardgame.name: The Jewel of Khadim Bey
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Cry for Vengeance

Daring thieves entered the grand palace last night and stole a fabled emerald from the bey of Zul-Bazzir. But one of the thieves was betrayed, and now asks you for help to get revenge! Will you ally with a thief to steal back the Jewel of Khadim Bey?

Savage Swords and Sinister Sorcery

"The Jewel of Khadim Bey" is a stand-alone sword and sorcery adventure module, inspired by the pulp era tales of Robert E. Howard and Clark Ashton Smith. Venture in the footsteps of Conan the Cimmerian, Satampra Zeiros of Uzuldaroum, Imaro of Nyumbani, and other fabled thieves, reavers and slayers!

Written for the Fifth Edition (5E) of the world's most popular roleplaying game, the adventure in this book can be easily adapted to any fantasy roleplaying game ruleset or edition.

Note: This standalone adventure was originally published as part of the collection "The Spider-God's Bride and Other Tales of Sword and Sorcery". This new version has been updated to fifth edition rules and includes new maps and artwork.

Book features:

A fully detailed sword and sorcery adventure for character levels 2-3
Use as a stand-alone module for an evening or two of play, or use the background information as the basis for several adventures
A mix of mystery, roleplaying, skulduggery, wilderness and city exploration, and deadly combat -- a chance for every character class to shine!
City and dungeon maps
New monsters and NPCs
New magic items

boardgame.name: The Victory Shopping Network Issue 04, Volume 01
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE Network for Buying Your Chance at Victory!

On an obscure channel and nestled into an odd spot on the web, you can find the Victory Shopping Network. Most people have no use for the weapons, armor, and other gear sold there, but Adventurers sure do!

Join hosts Jack Tolouse and Rebecca Mary-Ann Abernathy (the world-famous RMA) as they present another set of items that might, jsut MIGHT, offer you a chance at Victory!

This issue; a flying motorcycle with hard light wings! Enjoy the Beam Cycle by Raktach, presented from our special venue!

(Shopping Network offer only the chance of victory; you will need to provide the actual victory yourself. All sales are final. No warranty is offered, implied, or exists. Do not call your cable provider. Operators are not standing by).

boardgame.name: The Disappearance of Rembrandt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

'An alternate history adventure set in 17th century Amsterdam. A 5e Adventure for a group of 4th level characters.

About the Adventure
It is a cold October morning in 17th century Amsterdam. A group of well dressed, heavily armed men carrying muskets and pikes are gathered in front of a canal house. They have an appointment with the painter Rembrandt van Rijn. The purpose of their gathering is to pose for a painting that they have commissioned. However, the maid explains that Rembrandt is missing.

In this Occult Detective Adventure, your player characters will investigate the painter's disappearance. The characters will meet individuals portrayed on some of Remrandt’s most famous paintings such as The Night Watch, and the The Anatomy Lesson of Dr. Nicolaes Tulp.

Quick Guide
System: D&D 5E
Recommended Average Party Level (APL): 4
Theme: Occult Detective, Fantasy, Horror
Length: One Shot (3-5 hours)

Features
3 Maps
12 Tokens
20 Pages of Adventure
Fully statted creatures
Detailed Public Domain artwork

Trigger Warning
This is a dark horror adventure featuring adult themes. I suggest only playing this with people that are 18 years or older.

The adventure features subjects that might be triggering to some players. Make sure your players are comfortable with these subjects before you start playing.
Triggers: Blood and gore, body Horror, torture.

boardgame.name: Adventures in the Sakthelim Desert: Talshari Oasis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are few places in the burning wastelands that offer water. But those that exist are of immense significance for the caravan trade routes. One of those places is Talshari, a small settlement at an Oasis. Its fresh water wells are life-giving, and some claim that drinking the water brings good fortune. Desert travelers have been using Talshari as a midway resting point for centuries. In the last few days, travelers have returned from the desert with worrying news.

Two weeks ago, the water in the oasis started draining, and strange creatures have been spotted at night.

Summary
This adventure takes place in the heat of the desert and is divided into four acts.

Act 1 is about traveling through the desert and dealing with random encounters
Act 2 brings your characters to the Talshari inn where they will start their investigation and meet colorful characters.
Act 3 takes your characters deep underground where they will find the reason for the draining water.
Act 4 will bring your characters great rewards in an underground temple if they manage to defeat powerful creatures and solve ancient riddles.

Quick Guide
System: D&D 5E
Recommended Average Party Level (APL): 3-5
Theme: Fantasy, Desert, Exploration, Adventure
Length: Short Campaign (15-25 hours)

Features
Custom Maps. 8 Maps created by Meditating Munky. Including random encounters, the inn, caves, and underground structure.
NPCs. 10 Colorful NPCs that your characters can meet in the oasis.
Statblocks. 27 Monsters and NPCs with fully filled out statblocks.
Random Encounters. 10 Random encounters that will immerse your players in the beauty and horror of the Sakthelim desert.
Top Down Tokens. 18 top down tokens for Virtual Tabletop use by Jan Loos]
Optional Desert Rules. Optional rules for wearing armor and drinking water in the desert heat.

boardgame.name: ZombieZone (BGotMC edition)
boardgame.description:
This is the card reimplementation of the 2012 board game ZombieZone, for the Board Game of the Month Club.


ZombieZone is a battle arena where 10 humans and 10 zombies will fight to the death… on live television. From the safety of our homes, we watch the destruction unfold, placing bets on or against mankind. And some of us will even risk our own lives for a chance at fame and fortune. Will the money hungry-humans, armed with a shotgun and a brain make it out alive? Or will the flesh-hungry Zombies multiply and take them over?


ZombieZone is a head to head strategic battle for survival of humans vs. zombies. 2 players each use double-sided disc tokens, cards, and dice to maneuver around a gridded parking lot game board. Humans are armed with a shotgun for ultimate zombie destruction, and zombies spread quickly by taking over the humans (flipping the token over to reveal a zombie on the other side). The last one standing wins.

boardgame.name: Entropic Fantasy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Entropic Fantasy is a fantasy tabletop role-playing game powered by the Entropic Gaming System 2.0 System Reference Document. It can accommodate all types of fantasy settings and styles using the same set of mechanics. Designed with the principle of allowing maximum flexibility with fewer rules, characters can vary widely while still retaining the depth of their background, providing players with the means to translate their character concepts into something fully usable on the tabletop.

Using an escalating dice mechanic, from d4 through d12, a combination system that allows Skills to be combined with different Abilities to produce any possible action, character Qualities that can be used in-game to produce bonuses through Hero Points, and very flexible mechanics for combat and Talents (magic), EF keeps the rules medium while presenting players with more options and flexibility!

Whether it’s epic fantasy, dark fantasy, fantasy horror, pulp fantasy, or historical fantasy, Entropic Fantasy can handle them all! Powered by the Open Gaming License, fans and Third Party Publishers can take advantage of the simple mechanics to make EF THEIR game.

Entropic Fantasy is a complete standalone core rulebook built from the EGS 2.0 SRD. It does not require any other book to be playable.

Entropic Fantasy includes:

Twelve unique PC cultures to choose from.
An expanded list of Qualities compared to the SRD.
A large collection of fantasy equipment.
Magic character concepts.
An expanded list of Talents compared to the SRD.
GM guidance for creating games and adventures.
Example settings and adventures.
A lengthy bestiary.

boardgame.name: Isle of Lime
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A tale of a magical sword buried on an island is tantalizing to say the least. I mean, who leaves a valuable sword in a grave. Such a waste. You've been warned not to go grave robbing but if you wait till later, you might be able to borrow a boat and take a look around the Isle of Lime!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, for a single, third level PC

boardgame.name: Hell Night Hijinks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For one night a year the veil between terra-realm and the terror-realm is so thin that all hell breaks loose. When tricks and treats fill the streets of all the humanoid sectors and all the unspeakable horrors wreak havoc. Within this unholy tome you will find all the stuff needed to run the most spookiest night on neo-terraxx. from all the treats to scarf down to the baddies from terror-realm that will scare your socks off!! Included is:


The adventure “Detroit-Prime Up All Night”
Rules on how to Trick and Treat
Hell Night fantastical items and treats as well as mundane treats
Hell Night Masks to wear while Trick and Treating!
A few additional monsters to add to the holiday fun!
boardgame.rpg: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland

boardgame.name: Hostile Takeover
boardgame.description:
Hostile Takeover is a basic territory control war game. You and your friends must fight to take control of the fortifications in order to establish yourselves as the true leader of the city. There are a total of four groups vying for control and none of them are ready to back down. From their base of operations, they send out their units in attempt to acquire each facility. No one is infallible though, and if a group loses all three of their units, they’re out. In this war, there will only be one victor, do you have what you need to defend against a Hostile Takeover?

Hostile Takeover is a spin on Piecepack. The additions are 12-sided dice and some blocks for buildings. If you already have a piecepack, it’ll help you save some time on getting setup. No two games play out exactly the same either, since the maps are player generated every session. It’s up to you how you play and where you deploy, but one thing is for sure, you don’t know who will win.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Expedition to Zanthalar
boardgame.description:
Players take a trip to the fantasy world Zanthalar, going on quests, searching for treasure, and trying to be the first person to reach ten Expedition points.

The game plays out with seven different card types (to offer meaningful decisions and plenty of customization) in addition to the in-game resource, gold. On any given turn, a player will buy cards from their favorite card types, take an action to advance their position, and barter by exchanging cards for gold.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Oceans Eleven
boardgame.description:
Two players each get a conventional 52 card deck of their own, with 2s considered wildcards. Players compare the highest five card poker hand amongst all the cards they've turned up. (If fewer than five, the empty spots are considered worthless cards of a zero rank and no suit.)

Each turn, the player with the lowest hand among their best five cards then gets to either Fold or Take another card. Folding results in a point for the opponent and all the cards on both sides being discarded. If instead the player added a new card, hands are compared again. And again, the player with the lowest five card poker hand from the cards exposed gets to either take another card or fold.

When a deck runs out the other player gets a point and can keep playing, and scoring pts till their own deck runs out. First to six points wins. If both decks run out game ends also, and scores are compared.

boardgame.name: Summoner Wars (2ª Edição): Baralho de Facção – Avianos da Lança Celeste
Summoner Wars (Second Edition): The Skyspear Avians
Summoner Wars 2. kiadás: Égdárda klán frakciópakli
서머너 워즈: 하늘창 조류족 종족 덱
boardgame.description:
The Skyspear Avians are a group of winged warriors, capable of flying over foes and flocking into perfect formations. Led by the summoner Ava, no enemy is safe from the reach of the Skyspear Avian's aerial attacks.

—description from the publisher

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Filler Clash
boardgame.description:
Filler Clash is a free board game "print to play", but you don't need to print it to play.

It was created to fill in the gaps between games, to play while you’re waiting anywhere, or just for fun. Players can experience the action of a fighting game and RPG in less than 3 minutes per player.

The idea is simple: each player chooses a character that represents a fighting class. You can use a printed or digital version of it, it's the same! Then using dice, the players will take turns to defeat each other. The last one standing wins.

And something important, depending on the table you play at, it will change the battlefield.
For example a table of 4, or for 6. Or in a bar! Even in a classroom or in the car, even at the cinema before the movie starts.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Yeth Hound
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each issue of Creature Ecologies covers a different creature with pictures, educational information, and behavioral facts.

boardgame.name: Woodwose
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each issue of Creature Ecologies covers a different creature with pictures, educational information, and behavioral facts.

boardgame.name: Котерия: Средневековые типажи
boardgame.description:
Набор из шести готовых персонажей ранга закаленный в антураже мистического Четвертого крестового похода. С небольшими изменениями они также подойдут для приключений в средневековой Европе в целом и мирах низкого фэнтези.


Генуэзский арбалетчик
Критский лучник
Купец
Ланце спеццате
Пневматик
Сарацин

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens 21
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version
(for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

Additional batch of SRD Creatures

This pack contains 8 new Creature Tokens, 2 Guard Drakes, Basilisk, Pegasus, Violet Fungus, Otyugh, Ochre Jelly and Dryad! each with multiple color variants:

Total # of tokens in this pack: 98!

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens 22
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version (for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

Additional batch of SRD Creatures

This pack contains 8 new Creature Tokens, Tyrannosaurus Rex, Troll, Ettercap, Hippogriff, Roper, Lich, Mummy and Mummy Lord! each with multiple color variants:

Total # of tokens in this pack: 114!

boardgame.name: Hero Tokens Pack 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version (for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

This pack consists of 12 new Heroes (or Villains)!

Every token is available in 5+ color variants!

Total # of Tokens in this pack: 123!

boardgame.name: Hero Tokens Pack 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version (for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

This pack consists of 12 new Heroes (or Villains)!

Every token is available in Multiple color variants!

Total # of Tokens in this pack: 99!

boardgame.name: Wilderness Pack 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Our cliffs desperately needed an update, so we’ve got 3 new versions in 5 color variants!
Plus some matching Cave entrances

Total # of Assets in this pack: 2260!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Decor Pack 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With this pack, we are trying to fill some gaps in our library and also update the “Old” assets, bringing them up to our new standards

We are updating the Graveyards! Everything from coffins, graves, tombstones, sarcophagi to cobwebs
Total # of Assets in this pack: 663!

boardgame.name: Arbitrary Collection Expanded Volume 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Helpful List Arbitrary Collection Expanded #5

Another set of 10 more d100 lists created from Ennead Games content

The Helpful List Arbitrary Collection is a set of lists with 20 entries per subject matter. The Helpful List Arbitrary Collection Expanded (aka HLACE) series takes that concept and cranks it up a notch by making the lists have 100 entries/names/concepts/etc each. Each collection is a mixture of genres and themes.

Much of the content has been created using previous generators that Ennead Games has published, an example of that being the "Ritual Names" table. Think of this set as a collection of the results these generators can make, done so you can save time and just get the results, rather than spending time rolling on each of the tables.

As the content here is semi-randomly generated for a mixture of topics and genres, some entries may be more suitable for your games or stories when compared to others.

boardgame.name: Mononoke Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mononoke Forest

Mononoke Forest is a dark, magical forest that’s perfect for your next adventure.

It’s dark and full of secrets, but you can always find your way with the help of these magical pillars. There are so many things to inspect in this map – it’s such a unique location! You can hear whispers and laughter echoing in the distance, but who knows what they might be saying or where they come from.

This map is waiting for you to explore it! There are rumours that the voices lure wanderers into the water, pulling them in with tiny, dark hands and drowning many of them – all the while whispering that their hearts deepest desire will be fulfilled. Some say if you manage to escape alive, the spirits will keep their word…

boardgame.name: Decaying Dread Realm
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Decaying Dread Realm

A new adventure awaits you!

Decaying Dread Realm is a D&D battlemap of a floating isle hovering above a glowing red maelstrom, slowly consuming everything in this magical prison. The realm is lit with an eerie red light, while all the trees and plants slowly rot and wither away. A giant, dead tree has an entrance beneath its roots, while two magical pillars stand before it – though only one is lit...

This map will make your players feel like they are in the middle of their own horror movie! It’s perfect for any DM looking to create an unforgettable experience for their players. The map also includes a custom and very detailed adventure prompt. You can use it to give your players something different than what they might expect from other maps in your collection!

boardgame.name: Clifftop Nature Temple Entrance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Clifftop Nature Temple Entrance

Are you looking for a new forest map?

Clifftop Nature Temple Entrance is a beautiful battlemap that can be used in any tabletop RPG. It comes with an adventure prompt written just for it, so you'll have everything you need to get started easily.

This battlemap is beautifully detailed and ready-to-go for VTTs right after download, or easily home printed for a fun session at home. All you need are some minis, dice, and encounter stats for the man-eating plants that guard this temple!

boardgame.name: Heart of the Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Heart of the Forest

You're a DM, looking for a new forest map for your players to explore and fight on.

This Heart of the Forest map is perfect for any D&D game, whether it's a homebrew adventure or a campaign from the Wizards of the Coast! It has everything you need to make your combat come alive - including two pillars that are lit with magic, leading into a dark entrance between a giant tree’s roots…

The best part about this map? It comes with its own adventure prompt written just for it! All you have to do is print out this map (or load it in your favourite VTT program) and get ready to play some D&D tonight! Your players will love exploring this forest and fighting off the evil that has been luring travellers in to their death. What villain is out here? Find out by playing through our included adventure prompt today!

boardgame.name: Primitives Sacred Site
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Primitives Sacred Site

Do you need a new forest map for your next D&D game?

Primitives Sacred Site is the perfect battlemap to run an encounter with your friends. This forest has a giant tree with an entrance between its roots, leading to a site sacred for the local primitives. They have built wooden bridges and lookouts throughout this area, as well as placed two magical pillars before the tree. This map is ready for VTTs and easy home printing, plus it comes with a detailed adventure prompt written just for it!

The primitives are an ancient race of people who worship nature and revere magic in all forms. They believe themselves to be descended from the gods themselves, but they're not sure which ones... Now they live in harmony with their natural surroundings - hunting game, gathering berries and herbs, fishing in streams or lakes - living off the land as their ancestors did millennia ago.

You can buy this battlemap right now by clicking Add to Cart! It's perfect for your next D&D campaign because it includes everything you need at your fingertips; terrain features like trees and rocks, paths through the woods (and across bridges), lookout posts high up in trees where archers might keep watch over intruders entering their sacred space... Plus you'll get an adventure idea that takes place entirely within these woods so you don't have to go outside of your comfort zone when designing encounters or the story!

boardgame.name: Outbreak: Undead Game Dice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

“Survivor,” how strange it is for you to leave things to chance. With all you know, with all you’ve seen… You still think that the risks you take will leave you better off than the hordes of dead who would see you in bloody pieces. I envy your foolishness, but wish you the best.


- A Friend

boardgame.name: Outbreak: Undead Game Tokens
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These tokens allow a player to see how their skill checks can be resolved, for better or worse. It makes it easy to see who at the table is in the best position to help and who, themselves, need help.

boardgame.name: Reise durch den Harz
boardgame.description:
The players start at space 1 (Goslar) and the first to reach space 109 (Halberstadt) wins the game. On their turn, players roll a die and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published about 1920.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Phantom Blades: Executioners
boardgame.description: Endless combat styles. Compromises and confrontations, Bring everything to an end in this fateful duel!

boardgame.name: River City Saga: Three Kingdoms
boardgame.description: The characters of the Kunio-kun series run-amok in the world of Sangokushi.

boardgame.name: Red Goes Faster
boardgame.description: Racing

boardgame.name: Vengeance is Mine
boardgame.description: Vengeance is Mine has a time-manipulation mechanic that lets players speed up time and blink towards enemies, or rewind time to readjust combos

boardgame.name: Lineage W
boardgame.description: Fantasy

boardgame.name: Dice Poker
boardgame.description:
Playing poker with the dice. The players take turns rolling the dice and try to get results like in poker. Points are awarded depending on the result.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Princess and The Dragon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our Hero
You are Our Hero, a renowned knight. The Princess convinced the King to betroth you. The country celebrated your impending union. The ladies of the court flew into wedding planning. But then the Princess was taken captive by the feared Dragon. Exactly according to plan.

The Princess
In truth, you have no interest in the Princess. She is a shallow, intolerable creature. And the wrong gender to boot. She is a bigoted thing and believes she can “turn” you on your wedding night. The thought filled you with dread.

The Dragon
Your love affair with the Dragon would never be accepted, so you arranged to be “defeated” by the Dragon and run away together to a faraway land. Unfortunately, plans rarely survive contact with reality. It turns out the Princess is a powerful witch and has taken the love of your life hostage.

A Runs On Motif mini-RPG intended for solo and duo play.

boardgame.name: Heaven Burns Red
boardgame.description: Anime

boardgame.name: Bloodmuse: Murderhobo Modern Art
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twisted Art
Venture into the world of Murderhobo Modern Art with Bloodmuse! Take on the role of semi-retired adventurers that use monster and beast cadaver materials to create gruesome avant-garde art. Balance your art and adventures with a web of social obligations and managing your domain, a neglected but large neighborhood in a major city.

Dive deep into indie film style noir surrealism or take it to heights of silliness and absurdity! Explore what it means to be an epic hero, both the traumatic burdens and transforming into something more than mortal. Be ridiculous with grusesomely comedic art installations. Experiment and explore the possibilities of high-level shennanigans.

Bloodmuse includes:
Simple 3d6 Motif-based system with deep results.
Oracle for low prep, GM-less, and solo play.
Intuitive action type based traits.
Simple open-ended art form and guild system.
Unique Trauma approach to stress and injury with permanent Knots.
Call upon heroic Inspiration and develop epic Evolutions.
Social web of titles, favors, debts, Reputation, and Infamy.
Domain trait system for tracking the troupe's land grant.
Fast and intuitive NPC templating system, creating guidelines for NPC behavior and scaling NPCs directly in relation to player character scale.
Robust play advice and guidance.
Example city outline.
Numerous example NPCs: 9 city councilors, 11 city residents, 19 monsters, and 7 epic monsters.
Pre-generated characters: 5 companions, 8 player characters.
Quick reference summarizing the main rules.
Supports a broad spectrum of dark and surreal interpretations, from art house existentialism to over the top absurdity.

boardgame.name: Dinosaur Wizards in Space
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dinosaur. Wizards. In Space.
Be one of the few surviving dinosaurs. Who's a wizard. In space.

Explore a wonderful wild universe of aliens, strange planets, and cosmic rarities!

Includes a light but robust system that not only resolves actions, but also enables GM-less and solo play modes!

boardgame.name: Dracula Dice
boardgame.description:
The players act as vampires who want to collect as much blood as possible.

Players can only collect points by rolling blood drops, but it is also possible to snatch blood from the others. The game ends as soon as a player has reached 50 points.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Arthur's Legacy: Arthurian Modern Fantasy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avalon rises and legends are Reborn!

Take on the role of a Knight, a reincarnated mystical warrior in service to immortal Nobles.
Confront the return of magic to the modern world and explore the mysteries of this Age.
Become a new legend as you (re)discover your true nature.

Explore a rich setting with a modern take on classic tales!

King Arthur and his bastard son, Mordred, have returned with the rise of Avalon.
After a short but brutal civil war, they make a fragile peace and form the Kingdom of Avalon.
Arthur Pendragon rules as High King and Mordred Pendragon is heir apparent as First Prince, jointly ruling House Pendragon.
The rise of Avalon and Avalonain civil war throws the world into chaos, but most nations come to some accord with the Reborn in the aftermath. Each region and country has its own unique relationship with the Kingdom of Avalon.

Who will you give your vow?

Join the cause of Arthur as a member of Ordo Camelot. Join the cause of Mordred as a member of Ordo Morrigan. Or cast your lot with another Order or Lodge of Avalon.

Ordo Viridis are the Green Knights of lore. The Urban Knights of Ordo DuFleuve worship The City, while the Free Knights of Ordo DuLac venerate Honor above all else. Among the Fallen Lodges, there are the dread necromancers of the Tombknockers and the mad reality crackers of the Phantom Edge. Each has their place and purpose in the great kingdom.

System agnostic setting guide.

Focused on providing a world overview
Usuable with a variety of roleplaying systems
OSR and dice pool systems are popular among playtesters
Robust mythology and world history
Complete player character type (Knight) description, including social ties and special powers
Includes a quickplay engine for game night plays or fast rules-lite experience.
Includes a basic but complete build of the Motif Game Framework!

Includes short quickplay builds of the Motif Story, Character, World, and Action Engines
Fully modular, mix and match rules and patches, all using the "Motif way"
Easily fits with the roleplaying game system of your choice
The quickplay action engine provides a simple reference for adaptation to your favorite RPG system
Due to the modular nature, parts may be used in isolation and imported into your system of choice to round out features
The included NPC template system makes NPCs quick and easy to generate and simple to run, but complex in behavior and conflict consequences.

boardgame.name: Bitter Birds Baking Brittle Bread
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

words have no meaning here
Empty breaths. Mindless sounds. It does not matter.

Words Mean Everything Here
Shades of meaning. Chains of thought. On a winter's evening, I saw bitter birds baking brittle bread in an oven of skulls.

What the BLEEP is this game?
Bitter Birds Baking Brittle Bread (5B) is not a normal roleplaying game or storygame. There is no coherent sense of plot. There may not even be a continuous sense of character. Events may or may not follow each other.

Even where there is logic and causality, unexpected consequences, absurdist twists, and surreal hyper-chains dominate.

Forget Indoctrination
Leave behind all sense of “plot” and character progression. Forget everything you know about act structures, characterization, and meaningful stories. This is not that kind of game. We are not here to tell those stories.

Uh, what?
Bitter Birds Baking Brittle Bread is a “roleplaying game” or “storygame” in the sense that a player takes up a character slot and plays that role, tells that story. It also uses a dice-based system for scenes and actions.

5B differs in the genre or types of stories it tells. Instead of enabling clear stories like Tolkien-esque adventure or Lovecraftian horror, it is a framework for telling surrealist, absurdist, stream-of-consciousness, and other post-modern tales. don’t read this.

So, What Kind of Stories?
Bitter Birds is ideal for emulating the kinds of experiences provided by Kurt Vonnegut, Alejandro Jodorowsky, Tom Robbins, Jorge Luis Borges, David Lynch, Robert Anton Wilson, Andrei Tarkovsky, James Joyce, and Jan Svankmajer.

When playing 5B, ignore normal conventions. Remember those art-house and indie movies where you were pulled along by an illogical logic of intuition and subconscious associations. Reflect on those stories where you were left wondering what the hell just happened.

Think of fever dreams.

That is the blood and bones of Bitter Birds Baking Brittle Bread.

What's Included?
General guidance
Making characters
Answering world/narrator questions
Emulating characters
Resolving efforts as events/world changes instead of actions
Dice and action triggers for twists and special actions
Classic postmodern inspiration and collage methods
5 starter scenario seeds

boardgame.name: En Garde
boardgame.description:
Life is unfair - so is this game...

Each player is 3x attacker (red dice) and 3x defender (blue dice). On the dice there are sword symbols for attack and shield symbols for defence. Blue has more dice than red - yes, unfair...

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dark Santa Holiday Special
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ho! Ho! Ho! Behold the snow! The storm is on the way!

Oh! No! No! Nowhere to go! Dark Santa come to play!

Run and hide! Before you die! Krampus gets revenge!

Hungry elves! Reindeer hell! Fear the nearing end!

You and your friends discovered Krampus was real last Christmas. It was an accident. Who really expected that stupid book to actually work?

It was a hellish Christmas as dozens, even hundreds, of children were kidnapped. All of them were horrible beaten and chained. Some were even devoured.

As the ones who summoned him, only you could stop him. And you did. You tracked down Jack Frost and made a deal for an ice sword. With it and your ingenuity, you and your friends killed Krampus. Oops.

Now Santa has been filled with the power of Krampus, twisted by it. Instead of eating cookies and milk, he eats children. His reindeer are frothing monstrosities. The elves move across your country in Bacchanalian wave, indulging every vice and leaving broken bodies in its wake.

This Christmas, you must defeat Santa Claus and find a vessel for the spirit of Krampus. The Dark Solstice demands both an avatar of joy and an avatar of sorrow. You really hope this does not become a regular thing.

boardgame.name: Life and Times of a Mad Scientist: Like I Give A BLEEP
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Like I Give A BLEEP is GM-less, single-player roleplaying game focused on the wild lives of mad scientists and hyper-genius adventurers. Explore a world where you can do almost anything, but everything comes with a cost and unforeseen consequeces rule the day.

Whether human or alien, become a master of parascience and violating so-called natural limits. Portrary characters like everyone's favorite doctor, fan favorite grumpy grandpa, and other rule-bending inventors, thinkers, and researchers!

Genre and style flexible! As easily play a straight-faced game of serious ethical consideratitons as a wild, surrealist comic romp through time and space. Emulate your favorite mad scientist and wild inventor-adventurer cartoons, movies, and TV shows. Lean into whatever feel and style you love.

Uses a complete unified build of the Motif Game Framework, featuring the Motif Story Engine (solo RPG toolkit), Motif Character Engine (character/player emulator), and the Motif Action Engine (quickplay RPG system). The main rolls only use three standard six-sided dice. It produces interesting answers and rich results without complex charts to reference. A player facing system where only players roll, with NPCs and circumstances having consequences for player character failure.

Tuned for solo roleplaying! BLEEP includes story and character engines to provide a complete GM-ulator experience. It also provides modules for story plotting mysteries, handling story momentum, and introducing twists and turns. NPCs are quick to generate and obvious to run, but are additionally supported by a character engine to add uncertainty to their responses.

Exceed the laws of nature and explore a new world of possibilities! Enjoy a fast-paced, narrative-focused, free-flowing style as you pursue scifi, futurist fantasy, weird fiction, and comedic stories.

Key Features
Motif Story Engine based 3d6 system, simple yet deep
Player-facing resolution; only players roll.
Rules and guidance for building NPCs and NPC actions
Character Engine
Mysteries patch for guiding investigations and hidden knowledge problems
Twists & Turns patch for introducing story twists
Pendulum patch, creating swinging momentum
Example NPCs

boardgame.name: We Came In Peace
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We Came In Peace is solo roleplaying game focused on an alien who came bring Unity, but found a nightmare world of Splinters. A weird fiction survival-horror roleplaying game where you struggle to rebuild yourself while holding onto your true self. The sickness of this world corrupts you, even as you are restored.

Survive this terror planet and warn yourself of the danger!

Uses a complete unified build of the Motif Game Framework, featuring the Motif Story Engine (solo RPG toolkit) and the Motif Action Engine (quickplay RPG system). The main rolls only use three standard six-sided dice. It produces interesting answers and rich results without complex charts to reference. A player facing system where only players roll, with NPCs and circumstances having consequences for player character failure.

Supports duo play and solo roleplaying! You can easily run a one-player, one-GM game. However, We Came In Peace includes the main tools you need to play alone. Face the monstrous things of humanity and the many other bizarre Splinters of this wretched world!

Contact your main self or escape this unfathomable hell before it claims you! Enjoy a fast-paced, narrative-focused, free-flowing style as you struggle to survive, heal, and avoid the horrors Corruption.

Key Features
Motif Story Engine based 3d6 system, simple yet deep
Player-facing resolution; only players roll
Restoration, tracking your healing process
Disconnect, measuring how difficult your natural abilities are
Corruption, detailing your fall toward becoming a Splinter
Rules and guidance for building NPCs and NPC actions
Midnight Clock, tracking how close humans are to bringing overwhelming force
Sympathizer rules for gaining and using them
End game conditions and outcomes.

boardgame.name: No Angels Live Here
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

No Angels Live Here is GM-less roleplaying game focused on the unique mission of occult detectives to face down the supernatural influence of the Dark. A neo-noir weird fiction roleplaying game of temptation, dark powers, and determined investigators standing as the last bulwark against the spirits of the Dark.

Become a determined occult detective and form your own agency!

Uses a complete unified build of the Motif Game Framework, featuring the Motif Story Engine (solo RPG toolkit) and the Motif Action Engine (quickplay RPG system). The main rolls only use three standard six-sided dice. It produces interesting answers and rich results without complex charts to reference. A player facing system where only players roll, with NPCs and circumstances having consequences for player character failure.

Supports traditional multiplayer tables, duo play, GM-less collaborative tables, and solo roleplaying! Whether you want to explore the world in a single player experience or run a full table of eight, No Angels Live Here seamlessly supports multiple modes of play.

Answer your calling and join the battle against the Dark! Enjoy a fast-paced, narrative-focused, free-flowing style as you pursue noir and horror stories.

Key Features
Motif Story Engine based 3d6 system, simple yet deep
Player-facing resolution; only players roll.
"Determination" pool, representing drive and willpower
A corruption system of Temptation and Damnation
Shared team memories and relationship building
Agency building and reputation
Rules and guidance for building NPCs and NPC actions
Mysteries patch for guiding investigations and hidden knowledge problems
Twists & Turns patch for introducing story twists
The Stalking Dark patch for introducing increasing tension and weirdness
Pendulum patch, creating swinging momentum

boardgame.name: Gobble. Gobble! GOBBLE!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gobble. Gobble! GOBBLE!!! (GGG) is a casual game about uplifted awakened turkeys. Some contagious phenomena is awakening turkeys to intelligent self-awareness. Come to terms with your sentience, compelled to spread the uplift and awaken others.

Choose a mission of freedom or vengeance! You feel compelled to spread the awakening and uplift your brethren, but there is a key decision on your path. Will you pursue a colony, a safe settlement for your people? Or will you undertake a bloody path of revenge against the humans? The choice is yours!

Uses a simple demo build of the Motif Game Framework, featuring a two dice hack of the Motif Story Engine (solo RPG toolkit) and a simple build of the Motif Action Engine (quickplay RPG system). All rolls only use two or three standard six-sided dice. It produces interesting answers and rich results without complex charts to reference. Only players roll, with NPCs and circumstances having consequences for player character failure. Supports traditional multiplayer tables, duo play, and solo roleplaying!

Only four core stats and one resource pool! No complex sheets to track and follow. The game is tuned for fast, casual experiences while providing enough structure to keep things interesting. Four stats are ranked first to fourth, providing your talent at most tasks. A special pool of "Gobbles" can be used for a variety of things including using human tools, hypnotizing humans, and avoiding hits.

Join the turkey revolution and free your brethren! Enjoy a fast-paced, narrative-focused, free-flowing style as you pursue the awakening of your people. The revolutions gobbles on!

boardgame.name: Egregores: The Creepypasta Storytelling Game
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Egregores: The Creepypasta Storytelling Game is a one-page storytelling and chat party game. Share your fragmented memories of shadowy figures, creepy places, and unnatural shows.

The forgotten, slumbering gods in the Void Beyond begin to stir and change the world. The past becomes strange and mutable. Memories define the reality of history, even changing evidence to fit the recollections.

Egregores, the thought-forms and shared beliefs of people, are a gateway. Through "recovered" memories of creepypasta horrors, the gods of the Void Beyond find a way to be born into this world.

Those who remember are Touched and their group of friends are Doomed. This is the story of the horrible ends of those who receive the Touch of creepypasta memories and horrors, as well as the Doom that befalls all within their group. As the story grows and memories form, the past irrevocably changes and the curse of the remembered terror claims them all.

boardgame.name: Everest
boardgame.description:
The players try to be the first to reach the top of Mount Everest. To do this, they need equipment and help, as well as good weather.

The players roll the dice for the necessary equipment each turn in order to then continue up the mountain. They don't always succeed, but one will make it before the others...

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: NEVER Stop Smiling
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

NEVER Stop Smiling is a weird fiction game set in post-apocalyptic dytopia.
An unknown cataclysm tore apart the Earth and decimated humanity.
"Cursed lands" and "wild places" have subsumed the world.
The Happy Place is one of the walled cities housing the remnants of mankind.
There it is literally the law to NEVER Stop Smiling.
Players explore the dystopian society of The Happy Place and mysteries of the broken world they live in.
Characters usually cannot die, but can be lost to Aberration.
If a character dies, they will mysteriously resurrect off-screen and return to the story. However, the ressurection is flawed, leaving behind a disturbing resonance of instability.
The mysteries of the world can also be too much for the mind and soul to bear. Eventually, the Instability will become a permanent Aberration.
The gift of Undying also fades as characters venture too far from The Happy Place.
Uses a simple yet deep 2d6 system, tuned for the wild nature of the setting.
One die determines success or failure, while the other determines cost or advantage.
Character skills change the chances of success and advantage.
"Stones" representing favors and secrets are gained and spent.
Natures, Instability, and Aberration not only provide roleplaying guidance, but have impacts on the world and play.

This release provides a complete system, including:
Setting Introduction
Core dice system, including guidance on how and when to roll
Extended action rules
Action sequence and conflict rules
Narrative conditions making mental and spiritual conflict as important as physical battle
Special moves rewarding caution and sacrifice
Guidance for Aberration impacts
Overview of the wider world
Guidance for creating team ties and direction
Suggestions for beginning encounters
Character growth advice and guidance
Guidelines for a GM-less game
Dice oracle for solo, GM-lite, and emergent world play
Advice for worldbuilding and play modes, structure, and flow
Example beasts and characters

boardgame.name: Ballroom Ugly: The Bloodless Bloodsport of the Ball
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You have been invited to your first ball, a grand gala at that! This is your chance to make a good first impression as an independent person and keep the invites coming. Will you impress upon the host and special guests of your fine graces? Or will you prove a boor, shamed from the dance by ill-regard?

But this is no lax party! Your actions here and the connections you make will determine your fortunes and well-being in the coming year. Will you have the sensibilities to make amends and forge deals with quiet grace? Or will you flub your opportunities, creating disruptions and offending other guests?

Put on your finest wear and finest smile! It is time to make your true debut and shine!

Based on a condensed hack of the Motif Game Framework, Ballroom Ugly will support single player, duo, and regular group play.

Game Includes
Simple but descriptive player character template
Rules for tracking Regard and its impact
Gala rules and outline
Core 3d6 system with simple but deep results
System answers both action outcomes and questions about world details
4 action flavors and 4 story flavors to use with your rolls
A stress/injury system of narrative Conditions
Specialized attack moves that risk and attack status, regard, and may even inflict Conditions.
Brief dance card and calling rules
Robust NPC template system
Twists and Turns option
Showoff dance option
Setup suggestions

boardgame.name: Kaiju: Vroom Wojna Numeroun - Sacred Battle Supreme
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are one of the great Kaiju, the grandmothers of this world, ancient and unspeakable. Long have you slumbered peacefully, only awakening when the world falls off-balance. But now, you stir from slumber more and more often.

A rage stirs deep inside you that sometimes grows beyond your control. Others of your kind defy your commands and rise to challenge your authority as Empress of Kaiju, Queen of Monsters. Something is horribly wrong with this world.

Again, you have been awakened. The rage overwhelms you. You set out to the nearest Man-Scar (city) and wreck hell. Progress through a rampage to discover and confront what enraged you. Confront another ancient true Kaiju challenging your authority or set against you in a series of confrontrations. Resolutions provided for both winning and defeat.

Based on a condensed hack of the Motif Game Framework, Kaiju: VWN will support single player and duo play.

Game Includes
A complete character creation template to make your own distinct Kaiju.
Kaiju Traits like wings, armor, and extra intelligence.
Kaiju Trircks like ambush and escape moves.
Signature power with armor piercing, heavy damage, and status effect options.
Player-facing core 3d6 system with simple but deep results
System answers both action outcomes and questions about world details
4 action flavors and 4 story flavors to use with your rolls
Simple Health and Armor system
Negative effects after taking damage when injured
High bonus to all actions when at your last health
Balancing Rage and Focus, with rampages triggereed at high Rage and obsession triggered with high Focus.
Structure for going from rampage to big Kaiju battle to story wrapup.
System for gaining and calling upon allies
Damage and NPC scales

boardgame.name: Kreuzworte ABC
boardgame.description:
Form words and the best letter concatenations.

The players roll letters and try to turn these letters into words. Points are awarded according to length and complexity. However, the players must also find a word each round with which they can form a sentence after 5 rounds - because this is the only way to win the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lang lebe der König
boardgame.description:
A new king is appointed. But who will it be? Am I backing the right one? The winner is the player who bets on the right aspirant.

The players roll the dice and according to the result either put the aspirants forward towards the throne or increase their support - you can't do both and since you can only win with a lot of support for the aspirant who will also become king, you have to be a bit tactical...

—description from the publisher
